characters: AT THE END OF THE BAR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JACOB JOHNSON is sleeping.  It doesn't look like a pleasa experience.  He is sixteen, dirty blonde, his eyes visibl moving under closed lids as he sits huddle under a blanke his window seat.  The lights are dim -- the shade on the  window closed -- a bead of sweat dribbles down his forehe The HUMMING of the jet's engines vibrates through the cab The boy's eyes snap open. Jacob glances around nervously.  He looks like an escaped convict who just accidentally walked into the Policemen's Ball.  A GREYHAIRED MAN two seats away from him gives the teenager a cursory glance, then goes back to his book.  J lays his head back and tries to relax.  The engines conti to drone. Until a new noise starts.  A WHOOSHING NOISE. The sound is very faint.  But distinct from everything el Jacob frowns. The noise gets LOUDER.  Jacob's sure he's hearing it now. looks at the Greyhaired Man.  The man catches his eye and two of them stare at each other for a heartbeat - then Ja turns away.  The Man returns to his book.  And Jacob  immediately turns back to him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you hear that? The man gives him an annoyed look as the WHOOSHING gets  louder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hear what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That noise.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't hear anything. The man turns back to the book as the sound gets even LOU - like it's coming closer.  Jacob squirms in his seat --  sneaks a look at the man again.  How can he not hear that STEWARDESS walks by and Jacob catches her attention.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Excuse me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes? The WHOOSHING is completely obvious now.  The greyhaired tries to ignore the two people talking over him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is that sound?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's just the engines, sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, it's different.  It's not the  engines.  It's getting louder. The man sighs -- the stewardess smiles patronizingly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're just gaining altitude to get above  some rough weather.  That's the sound of  the engines speeding up a bit.   Everything's fine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Um...okay. The stewardess walks away as Jacob sits back and starts t bite his nails.  The whooshing is really starting to BLAR now.  He looks between the seats in front of him -- twist around to look behind.  He snaps back to the greyhaired m JACOB (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can't you hear that? GREYHAIRED MAN (losing patience)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, kid.  Will you relax?  It's just  the damn engines, okay? The man glares at him, and Jacob backs off.  The sound ha grown DEAFENING.  Jacob grinds his seat like he's going m He looks at the closed window.  He reaches out his hand,  grabs the handle then rips up the shade for all to see: A 747 coming RIGHT AT US. Jacob SCREAMS.  The planes CRASH. Impact - decompression - explosion.  The hull of the cabi buckles violently - moaning like a dying elephant - peeli inward revealing RED AND GREEN STRIPING on the outside. A huge wing section RIPS through the structure - barely  missing Jacob - taking the greyhaired man's head clean of nailing the stewardess in the gut and shoving her body ac and out the other side of the cabin. And Jacob's seat drops down - sending him and us into:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Like an intricate ballet, Jacob, his body strapped to his chair, tumbles away from the DC-10 and 747 as they seem t merge and bend into some kind of mutant DC-47 - wings and tails wrapping around each other as debris blooms out lik flower and together they EXPLODE - a fiery ball lighting nighttime clouds and Jacob's shrieking face.   And Jacob falls and falls and falls, his hair sticking  straight up from the blasting wind. That's when CORPSES start falling past him.  The captain the plane - the stewardess, her body bent in half - the  greyhaired man, his head gone but his book still in his h More men, women, crew people - and CHILDREN. But these children aren't dead bodies.  Two LITTLE GIRLS one LITTLE BOY, all dressed in white, plummet down next t Jacob, head first, like high divers.  And they're singing THE CHILDREN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One two, Freddy's coming for you... The children turn around in the sky so that they are  travelling feet first.  The Little Boy's pants puff up an the Girls' skirts poof out and RIP UPWARD - the wind taki away their clothes and their skin and their bodies and th hair... THE CHILDREN (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Three four, better lock your door... Leaving three tiny SKELETONS - taunting and laughing as J screams and covers his eyes. THE CHILDREN (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Five six, grab your crucifix... And the Skeletons sprout wings - leathery and veiny - the wind catching them and sending them up and away as their  voices echo in the sky. THE CHILDREN (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Seven eight, gonna stay up late... Jacob takes his hands away from his face and starts to  frantically pull on his seat belt.  SNAP - it flies off h back and miraculously turns into a PARACHUTE.  Rope swirl into the air - the wind grabs the canvas - and Jacob's bo slows with a violent jerk. But at least he's not falling anymore.  Jacob catches his breath as he starts gently floating through the sky.  He  smiles.  This isn't so bad.  This is actually kind of fun Not for long, though, because his new upward momentum car him back up to: The winged children's Skeletons.  Jacob's eyes bug out as rises into them and they start to circle.  They move clos and we can see something in their hands:

dialogues.speaker: SCISSORS
dialogues.text: Jacob twists his body, trying to steer his parachute away from the demons.  One of the Skeletons swoops up to his f and pokes its scissors inches away from Jacob's eyes.  It sings alone: CHILD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nine ten, never sleep again! The Skeleton cranks its arm back - ready to plunge the  scissor's blades into Jacob's sockets.  The arms swings  toward him - then suddenly diverts up past his head, head for:

dialogues.speaker: THE CHUTE'S STRINGS
dialogues.text: The Skeleton flaps its wings and poises its scissors at o of the ropes.  The other two Skeletons join it over Jacob head.  The three of them look down at Jacob, their boney in a perpetual smile. JACOB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No! The Skeletons nod "yes".  SNIP - SNIP - SNIP - they cut a at Jacob's parachute as he swings underneath them, trying pull away - SNIP - SNIP. The parachute flutters away - the Skeletons cackle - and  Jacob plummets.

dialogues.speaker: ON JACOB
dialogues.text: We stay with him as he screams and shrieks and yells and clouds part and the ground rises quickly up to meet him. ground becomes a town, the town becomes a block, the bloc becomes a house, the house becomes a roof, and...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: KA-BLAM!  The ceiling explodes as Jacob's body plows thro slams down, shatters the bed, and we immediately:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jacob's eyes blast open as he sits up from bed in a cold  sweat.  A dream.  The worst fucking dream from hell anyon would ever want to have -- but still just a dream.  He ta a few deep breaths as a soft KNOCK is heard at the door. JACOB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.. ALICE JOHNSON opens the door and sticks her head in.  She thirty-two, blonde, with a caring smile. ALICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You okay, honey? JACOB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, Mom.  I'm fine. ALICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alright.  Better get cooking or you'll be  late for school. JACOB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On my way. Alice closes the door as Jacob gets out of bed and stretc Sunlight is leaking through the bedroom window shade and  Jacob walks over to it.  He reaches out and pulls up the  shade. And there's nothing buy sky.  Jacob frowns and pokes his out the window.

dialogues.speaker: THE GROUND
dialogues.text: is once again racing up towards us at seven-thousand mile hour.  The entire house is falling.

dialogues.speaker: BACK IN THE BEDROOM
dialogues.text: Jacob leaps away from the window.  The WINGED SKELETONS  reappear outside -- dancing in the air -- cackling with g The bedroom starts to SHAKE violently as Jacob stumbles i the center.  The roof starts caving in and the walls begi to crumble. ANGLE STRAIGHT DOWN ON JACOB. Jacob grabs his head, looks up at us, and SCREAMS.  We  suddenly stay where we are as the house drops down and we punch out through the roof and our shot becomes an:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: as it falls away towards the ground.  We watch as it beco a small dot - and finally impacts on the surface.  A mush cloud of smoke silently puffs out in the distance below

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Smoke and dust whirl around a huge hole in the earth.   Splintered shreds of lumber stick up in the air like gian toothpicks.  Some of the toothpicks start to move. Jacob rises out of the destruction, charred, scraped,  battered and, unfortunately, alive.  He climbs up to the of the crater.  He looks back a the remnants of his home. Then something starts to happen. Something his growing from the crater - spreading out.  I not a cloud, it's not smoke - it's a DARKNESS.  Even thou it's night, this darkness is darker.  It creeps out from hole - fingers of blackness reaching out.  What it covers doesn't disappear.  It becomes GLOOMY.  The shroud is get bigger. And it's getting faster.  Jacob runs.

dialogues.speaker: WITH JACOB
dialogues.text: He bolts down the streets of the small town in a blind pa He looks behind him and sees the darkness getting bigger, gloominess covering houses.  Then whole blocks. Everything it touches seems to fall deeper into SHADOW.

dialogues.speaker: AT THE STREET CORNER
dialogues.text: Jacob comes across a WOMAN walking her dog.  He stops and yells at her. JACOB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get the hell out of here!  It's coming! WOMAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's coming? Jacob points down the street.  The shroud is swooping dow the road - browning out street lights in its wake.  And t woman doesn't find anything threatening about this.  Jaco screams at her. JACOB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't you see it? WOMAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: See what? And it's obvious now: she doesn't see anything.  The Woma totally oblivious to the danger.  Jacob shakes his head - stumbles away. The woman watches him go as the darkness PASSES OVER HER. She sighs. And begins to MUTATE.  Her hair gets scraggly, her skin  bursts out in sores, her back grows a hump -- all of whic she DOESN'T seem to notice. She just shrugs her twisted shoulders. WOMAN (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kids...watcha gonna do? She hobbles away with her dog - which now has six legs an two heads.

dialogues.speaker: BACK WITH JACOB
dialogues.text: Like a bat running from hell, he tears through the street passing buildings that turn creepy and people that become passively accepting monsters. A VOICE booms out from nowhere. FREDDY (O.S.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jacob!  You're too old to run away from  home! Jacob covers his ears and races out of town.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jacob falls onto the deserted road just outside of town. rolls on the asphalt and looks behind him.  most of the t is covered in an opaque gloom.   Suddenly a CACKLING sound is heard and Jacob turns to its source:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The town can still be seen behind it -- the darkness over almost all of it now.  The sign reads: WELCOME TO SPRINGW POPULATION... And the numbers after the word "population" are changing. They're counting BACKWARDS, clattering away like an old-t gas pump in reverse - faster and faster - blurring as the "thousands" digit disappears, then the "hundreds", then  "tens", then... CLINK - the count stops at "1".  Springwood is entirely  engulfed in the shroud.  There is a pause. CRASH - the sign is violently YANKED into the ground.  It vanishes into the earth and a CRACK APPEARS at the edge o the road. The crack grows - moving out to the center of t highway.

dialogues.speaker: BACK ON THE STREET
dialogues.text: Jacob watches the crack as it splits wider in the middle the street and a GURGLING sound starts to build.  The tar front of Jacob becomes molten.  It bubbles and pops. Jacob scrambles backwards as something begins to rise fro boiling asphalt. It's a hat. The hat, a fedora to be precise, pushes itself up. A left hand - burned and scarred - pokes out next to it.  Four s blades jut out of the muck on the other side.  A head is now - a curtain of tar dripping from the rim of the hat - hiding the face.  The body beneath the head ascends.  The veil of asphalt parts: It's FREDDY KRUEGER.  Jacob SCREAMS. Freddy LAUGHS.  He shakes off his layer of tar and looks  towards the clouded town of Springwood.  A look of pure  hatred appears on his ragged face. FREDDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Payback time... Freddy opens his mouth - lets out a large breath - and th INHALES an even larger one. A WINDSTORM starts, the source being Krueger's own lungs. The gale force begins to yank at the shroud surrounding  Springwood.  Fingers of darkness pull up from the town an towards Freddy's mouth -- and houses begin to DISSOLVE.   Freddy continues to inhale like he's never going to stop. Krueger is sucking the black gloom into his body - and th entire town of Springwood is going with it.  Trees,  buildings, cars, picket fences.  It's all crumbling and  fusing, becoming a part of t cloud that itself is caught the nightmarish wind tunnel, all piling into Freddy's mou The vortex swirls into Krueger.  Then it's gone.  Nothing a vacant lot the size of a town remains.  Freddy turns to Jacob and BURPS, it sounds like a THUNDERCLAP. JACOB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No! FREDDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't worry, I have a strong stomach. Freddy reaches down and yanks up his red and green sweate He pulls apart his putrid abdomen to reveal his guts - an transparent stomach. Inside the stomach: a black swirling mass.  Flashes of  houses, people, homes, couples, all trapped in horrible  anguish.  Freddy drops down his sweater. FREDDY (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Springwood is mine, boy! JACOB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I dreamed you away before I was born!   Mom said you couldn't come back! FREDDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is that true?  Then she told you all  about me, huh? Let's see what else she  has to say. Freddy reaches his left hand into the bubbling tar at his feet, digs around a bit, then pulls out: ALICE.  Jacob's mother.  Tar dripping down her body.  Kru has her by the neck, waves his blades in front of her.  J gets up and runs toward him. Freddy pulls a foot up from the asphalt pit and KICKS Jac back a good fifteen feet. ALICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Run, Jacob! The boy rolls painful on the hard road.  He sits up and  screams: JACOB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leave her alone! FREDDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're such a momma's boy! Freddy swings his knives out, pauses for a terrifying bea then swoops the daggers towards Alice.

dialogues.speaker: JACOB
dialogues.text: as OFF SCREEN we hear a horrible multiple GLITCH!  Jacob  shrieks in gut-wrenching anguish.

dialogues.speaker: SCENE
dialogues.text: We're far enough away so that we don't barf at the sight close enough to see that Freddy has impaled Alice's body his blades.  He lifts her up effortlessly and raises her figure RIGHT OVER HIS HEAD. Krueger swings his arm out, shaking off Alice, sending he flying over Jacob's head.  The body lands behind him.

dialogues.speaker: ON JACOB
dialogues.text: as he runs to his mother.  She VANISHES just as he reache out to touch her bloody body.  He turns to Krueger and ra his fists.  A look of sheer rage is growing in him, blind insane anger.  He bellows: JACOB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You fucker! FREDDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Springwood is only the beginning.  All I  need from you is a ride! Suddenly, between Jacob and Freddy, three SHAFTS OF LIGHT burst up from the road.  Three FIGURES appear as the ligh dissipates. They're dressed in metallic black, heavy boots, helmets w dark visors covering their faces.  One is large and muscu The one in the center has an obviously feminine figure un her skin-tight outfit.  The third is a little smaller tha the other two with a slightly different face  that allows to see his mouth. They're the DREAM POLICE.  Jacob doesn't know this yet, b Freddy seems to.  The bastard son of a hundred maniacs fr at the sight of these new apparitions. Then he looks past them and smiles at Jacob. FREDDY (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: See ya later! Freddy violently DROPS down into the bubbling asphalt pit Two of the black figures start after him.  The third one  turns to Jacob as his partners leap into the hole after  Freddy.  The sound from his exposed mouth is DEAFENING! SOUND COP

dialogues.speaker: WAKE UP
dialogues.text: Jacob grabs his ears in pain as we suddenly:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jacob's eyes snap open so fast his sockets suffer whiplas He's lying smack in the middle of the road tucked in a fe position.  Jacob slowly uncurls his body and sits up.  He shivers and wipes his sweaty forehead - and that's when h notices something in his hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: it's a bracelet, a simple band of gold with a larger plat the middle, like an ID band.  Jacob's fingers turn the pl over. Printed on the other side is the name of the bracel former owner: ALICE.  Jacob has a souvenir.

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO JACOB
dialogues.text: He raises his face and looks at the road in front of him. goes off into the distance surrounded on both sides by em fields.  This is where Springwood used to be.  A look of anguish  crosses Jacob's face as he stares at the desolation. JACOB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mom...

dialogues.speaker: HONK
dialogues.text: Jacob whips his head around in time to see a huge moving blasting right at him.  He rolls off to the side of the r The truck barely misses him, kicking up a cloud of dust i its wake. Jacob chokes on the dust.  He slowly recovers and looks b down at the bracelet in his hand. He clenches his fist ar it as a wild-eyed angry look starts to grow on him.  He t a few deep breaths, then stands up and walks OUT OF FRAME

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We can see a pickup truck in the distance. Jacob's HAND  ENTERS FRAME, thumb sticking out, his mother's bracelet  dangling from his wrist. The pickup truck starts to slow down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A sprawling little community with pleasant streets and  cheerful houses.  It looks a lot like Springwood, the onl real difference being that it actually exists.  It also h sign: WELCOME TO ROSEDALE.  POPULATION: 8,786 A Volkswagon bus drives past the sign and stops a couple blocks down the road from us.  Jacob steps out of the  passenger side and wearily waves his ride goodbye.  He  shuffles into town.

dialogues.speaker: YET ANOTHER SIGN
dialogues.text: It reads: DRUG ADDICTS NOT WELCOME TO ROSEDALE! The sign pulls away to reveal a middle-aged man with an a expression: MR. HOPKINS MR. HOPKINS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Clean up your act somewhere else! He walks along as we PULL BACK TO SEE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a nice-looking two-story house in the middle of a  usually quiet neighborhood.  Today the home is surrounded about a dozen townsfolk carrying picket signs: NO HALFWAY

dialogues.speaker: HOUSES IN OUR NEIGHBORHOOD
dialogues.text: VALUES!, and GO BACK TO JUVENILE HALL!  The crowd mumbles amongst itself, occasionally bursting out with a chant in protest.

dialogues.speaker: ON JACOB
dialogues.text: We catch him walking down the sidewalk.  He tramps along his hands stuffed in his pockets and his eyes on the  pavement.  He looks like he hasn't slept in days.  The so of the crowd ahead of him finally grabs his attention. Jacob approaches the disturbance and comes across a young girl standing behind a bush holding a BAG OF GROCERIES. is KAREN MILLER, dark hair, sixteen, very pretty, but wit faraway look in her eyes. Jacob stands next to her and stares at the crowd like a  zombie.  She doesn't turn to look at him as he speaks: JACOB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's going on? KAREN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Free speech.  The right of assembly. JACOB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is this place? KAREN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a home.  A foster home.  For  teenagers.  It's where you go when things  get bad.  It's the place to figure out  what to do next.  It's a home for kids  that no one else wants. (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's MY home. Karen hasn't looked at Jacob once.  She suddenly seems to steel herself and walks away from the bush, towards the  house.  Jacob is befuddled. JACOB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh... He stands there and watches.

dialogues.speaker: IN FRONT OF THE HOUSE
dialogues.text: Karen quickly makes her way into the crowd of people, hea up, eyes staring forward.  The crowd parts ever so slight as the irked townsfolk start to heat up.  They have an ac human to vent their anger on now.  Mr. Hopkins lays in on as she passes him. MR. HOPKINS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why can't you find somewhere else to  shack up? Karen turns to him, still walking, flustered and hurt. KAREN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What have we ever done to you? MR. HOPKINS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing...YET. Karen turns quickly away from him and trips over a sprink head.  Her groceries tumble onto the grass.  A hand reach down to help her.  It's Jacob's. He quietly helps her re-bag her groceries as Mr. Hopkins  looms above them.  Both angry and embarrassed now. MR. HOPKINS (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, we've been here for years.  This is  a quiet street.  We'd just like to keep  it that way. Jacob can't take this guy anymore.  He stands up and face the older man with a scowl. JACOB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lighten up, mister. MR. HOPKINS (smirks)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And what gutter did you crawl out from,  kid? (frowns)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We don't want your kind here. JACOB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My kind?  What kind is that? MR. HOPKINS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Drug addicts.  Dope pushers.  We have  stand up and take charge. JACOB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Swell.  I've just got a couple of  questions for you...Do you love your  parents? MR. HOPKINS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course I do... JACOB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are they alive? MR. HOPKINS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My mother is. JACOB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's it like? Jacob stares at Hopkins.  He doesn't answer.  He just huf and puffs as Karen grabs Jacob and pulls him up to the fr porch of the home, then into the floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Karen slams the door and takes a deep breath. KAREN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Assholes. JACOB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can think of a stronger word.  Are you  okay? KAREN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.  Thanks.  I'm Karen. JACOB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jacob. Jacob suddenly gets a little light-headed and has to use wall to hold himself up.  Karen looks concerned. KAREN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are YOU okay? JACOB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.  I just haven't had much to eat  lately. KAREN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then come help me unpack. She smiles and leads him further into the house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jacob is feverishly eating a sandwich at the table while  Karen finishes putting the rest of the food away. KAREN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I guess the sandwich is alright, huh? JACOB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's incredible.  Best I've ever had. KAREN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're not from around here, are you? JACOB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.  I've been on the road for a couple  of days. KAREN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you need a place to stay? FOOTSTEPS are heard from below and a couple in their mid- thirties enter from the basement door.  They're DAVID and MARY ROSS, both greasy and frustrated. MARY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So, we have to get it fixed. DAVID

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We don't have the money to get it fixed. They both start washing up at the sink, not really notici the teenagers in the room.  Karen speaks up. KAREN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's wrong? DAVID

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Our plumbing has a bad case of hardening  of the arteries.  Who's your friend? David gives Jacob a wary glance as the boy stands shakily KAREN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is Jacob. JACOB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jacob Johnson. DAVID

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: David Ross.  My wife, Mary. KAREN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They run this house.  They're helping me  and three other ids get a footing in  reality before they kick us out of the  nest to make room for the next batch. David is looking out the window at the now dissipating cr He lets out a weary sigh. DAVID

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If there is a next batch.  I see the  welcome wagon is back.  Was there any  trouble? KAREN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A little.  Jacob came to my rescue. MARY (pleasant)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where you from, Jacob? JACOB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Springwood. MARY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Springwood?  Where's that? JACOB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Upstate about a hundred miles. DAVID (suspicious)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know this state like the back of my  hand.  I've never heard of Springwood. There is an uncomfortable pause.  Then Karen suddenly bre in. KAREN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jacob's a little down on his luck.  I  told him he could stay here a few days. Jacob gives here a surprised look. MARY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are your parents in Springwood? JACOB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My father died before I was born.  My  mother, she's dead, too. DAVID

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You have a legal guardian? JACOB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. DAVID

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Been in any state or federal program? JACOB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. KAREN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just for a little while.  So he can get  his bearings. DAVID

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Got any ID? Jacob reaches for his back pocket - it's empty.  He shake his head "no". MARY (to David)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think we can help him out, honey.  The  budget's tight, but we can't turn down  someone in need. David doesn't acknowledge his wife, he just stares at Jac sternly.  Karen bites her nails.  Then David sits down an starts to lecture. DAVID

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay.  You got three, maybe four days to  rest up while we try and find a more  permanent arrangement for you.  But his  isn't going to be a free ride.  We're  part of a community summer work project  and eighty percent of the money you make  goes to the house.  Everybody works - and  that includes you.  Are you on drugs? JACOB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. DAVID

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good.  If I catch anything stronger then  an aspirin on you, you're outta here.  No  arguments.  You got that straight? JACOB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, sir. DAVID

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay.  Dinner in two hours.  Why don't  you go meet the rest of the gang. KAREN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks, David. MARY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll go fix up the spare bed in Wesley's  room. David gets up.  He gives Jacob a final once-over. DAVID

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And take a shower, for chrissakes. David leaves the room.  Karen gives Jacob a huge grin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Karen leads Jacob into the room.  There are two teenagers the couch: WESLEY is a fifteen-year old, curly hair, kind small.  GINA is also fifteen, brunette hair, seems pretty happy. KAREN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, guys, I got someone for you to meet.   This is Jacob.  Jacob, this is Wesley and  Gina. JACOB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi. WESLEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Welcome to fun central. KAREN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's going to be staying with us for a  while. GINA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh yeah?  How'd you get through the  blockade? Another kid, SCOTT, pops into the room.  He's sixteen, da hair, with a tough-guy I could give a shit attitude.  He  doesn't seem to care about anybody in the room, except fo Karen. SCOTT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, beautiful.  How's it going? KAREN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi, Scott. Scott notices Jacob and frowns.  Karen is a little annoye SCOTT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who's Barney Rubble? KAREN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is Jacob Johnson.  He's a new  resident.  At least temporarily. SCOTT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He better not be rooming with me.  I  value my privacy. KAREN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, I believe that honor goes to Wesley. WESLEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good.  I could use the company. SCOTT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So what's your story?  Divorce?  Custody  battle?  Your parents just plain  assholes? JACOB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're dead. KAREN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mellow out, Scott.  Give him a chance to  settle in. SCOTT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just curious. Scott reaches into his shirt pocket and pulls out a pack cigarettes.  As he lights one up, Wesley's cheerful attit suddenly turns grim.  He gets up from the couch and quick leaves the room.  Karen gives Scott an angry look. JACOB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is he alright? SCOTT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He'll be fine.  He just has a problem  with cigarettes. GINA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His parents used to use them as a sick  kind of discipline.  That's why he's  here. JACOB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you know that, then why do you smoke  in front of him? SCOTT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's not my problem. This really pisses Jacob off.  These two are not going to along very well. JACOB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just what is YOUR problem, then? SCOTT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I took care of my problem.  That's why  I'M here. Scott lets out an aloof puff of smoke and leaves.  Jacob  gives Karen a confused glance. KAREN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His dad used to beat him.  One day he  couldn't take it any more. JACOB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What happened? KAREN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He killed him with his father's gun.   Self-defense. Jacob sits down on the couch and lets that sink in.  Gina scootches away from him on the couch, then gives him a gl look. GINA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everyone here has a fun tale to tell.   Isn't that right, Karen? Karen is staring out the window.  She has that spaced-out expression we saw before when she was hiding behind the b KAREN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.  Right. No one has anything left to say.  Gina turns the sound on TV back up as the three sad kids start to watch cartoons.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jacob is alone in the dark watching some kind of NICK AT  NIGHT b&w sit-com re-run.  A cheerful family lovingly ban away on the flickering tube.  Jacob just stares blankly. Karen sleepily shows up at the doorway in a long tee-shir with a glass of milk. KAREN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why don't you go to bed? JACOB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't sleep. KAREN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You need to talk? JACOB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.  I'm fine.  Thanks. Karen gives him a worried look and heads off to bed.  Jac continues watching TV with a creepy glean in his tired ey

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The kids are here cleaning up the building.  The guys thr rotted lumber into trash bins while the girls sweep up. catch Jacob and Scott tossing some debris into a wheelbar Jacob looks pretty ragged. SCOTT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on.  Let's hop to it.  Gotta make  way for those new indoor tennis courts.   The fate of the world lies in the  balance.  Okay, this load's full. Jacob grabs the handles of the wheelbarrow and shakily pi it up.  Scott sneers. SCOTT (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You got that? JACOB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, no problem. SCOTT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know.  Maybe you should think  about switching to de-caf or something. Jacob ignores him and pushes the wheelbarrow along.  Scot takes some time off to smoke a cigarette.  He spots Karen across the room bending over with a dustbin.  Scott linge on this view for a long time.

dialogues.speaker: AT A DUMPSTER
dialogues.text: Jacob pulls up with the wheelbarrow and starts to unload junk.  Gina is next to the dumpster sweeping.  She tries push a large crate aside by herself, but slips and falls. Jacob jumps over to her, reaches out, and grabs her arm t help her up. JACOB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You okay? Gina SCREAMS. GINA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No!  Yes!  Let go of me! She shakes off his grip and he jumps back.  She runs away with a wild look in her eyes as Karen steps up to a confu Jacob. KAREN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She doesn't like to be touched. JACOB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No shit! KAREN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't take it personally.  It's not her  fault. JACOB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What happened to her? KAREN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Her mother was a hooker.  She forced Gina  to carry on the tradition.  When she was  thirteen... JACOB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus. Jacob looks off at Gina with genuine concern.  Karen give him the same expression. KAREN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You look terrible. JACOB (smiling)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks. KAREN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry...I just wish you'd tell me  what happened to you, that's all. JACOB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't talk about it right now.  I'll  tell you later.  I promise. KAREN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay.  Why don't you sit and rest for a  bit.  The supervisor's not around.  You  look like you could use it. JACOB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think I will. He gives her a gentle squeeze on the forearm, and Karen l it.  Jacob spots a pile of wood next to a wall and heads for it.

dialogues.speaker: ON SCOTT
dialogues.text: He's watched the entire interchange between Jacob and Kar and he DOESN'T like it.

dialogues.speaker: WITH JACOB
dialogues.text: as he goes around the stack of lumber and sits down facin the brick wall.  He lets out a heavy sigh and stares at t inside of the building.

dialogues.speaker: THE BRICK WALL
dialogues.text: sits there quietly for a few beats until:

dialogues.speaker: IT EXPLODES
dialogues.text: Bricks fly out at us as a gaping hole blows into the wall revealing nothing but BLACKNESS and our shot MOVES throug

dialogues.speaker: DREAM FLASHES
dialogues.text: Horrifying apparitions and images ZOOM by us.  Gloomy  buildings under a pitch black sky.  MUTANTS and twisted  MONSTERS.  Shadowy streets and dark alleyways.  And FIVE  RAZOR-BLADE FINGERS suddenly ripping right through the sk and down upon us as a VOICE rings out. VOICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, you!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jacob's eyes are closed as a SUPERVISOR looms above him. SUPERVISOR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No slacking off.  Back to work. The boy's eyes snap open and he jumps to his feet like a  babbling crazy man. JACOB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What!  Jesus fucking...Oh, shit! SUPERVISOR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whoa!  Get a grip, boy. The supervisor backs off from Jacob as he slowly gets use reality again. JACOB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Huh?  What's going on? SUPERVISOR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing.  That's the problem.  Now that  you've gotten your beauty rest, let's see  if you can change it, okay? Jacob calms down and nods.  He walks away, snatching a  nervous glance at the perfectly normal brick wall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We watch as various lit windows go dark and the residents the house go to bed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wesley is getting in bed.  Jacob is sitting in a chair  staring out the window.  Wes switches off the lights and  turns to Jacob. WESLEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aren't you going to bed? JACOB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not tired. WESLEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bullshit.  If you looked any more tired,  you'd be dead. Jacob cracks a weary smile in the darkness. JACOB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's right. WESLEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You gotta sleep, man. JACOB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why?  Who says?  You know, people don't  even really know why we sleep.  They  haven't found any physical reason for it. WESLEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But they do know that you go nuts if you  don't. JACOB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sharks don't sleep.  They can't pump  water through their gills on their own.   They have to always keep moving.  If they  stop, they can't breath.  If they go to  sleep, they die. WESLEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're not a shark. JACOB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know.  I'm just a kid.  Don't worry  about me, Wes.  Go to sleep. Wesley shakes his head and gets under the covers.  Jacob  continues to stare out the window, desperately trying to his eyes open.

dialogues.speaker: THROUGH WINDOW
dialogues.text: the trees sway quietly in the breeze outside.  There is a pause.  Then we are suddenly PULLED THROUGH THE WINDOW,  SMASHING glass, careening back into:

dialogues.speaker: DREAM FLASH
dialogues.text: We SAIL through the gloomy air, over the creepy buildings And suddenly DIP DOWN, right for the street, and end up  CRUISING three inches off the asphalt, really ripping dow the road until we grind to a SUDDEN HALT.  Right in front FREDDY'S FEET.  Our shot TILTS UP.  Freddy looms above us grins. FREDDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can't stay awake forever, boy! He LAUGHS, his mouth gaping wide, and then splitting open impossibly wider.  Something starts pouring out of his mo right at us. Hundreds of GIANT BUGS spew down upon us, covering us  completely as everything goes to BLACK and we:

dialogues.speaker: ON JACOB
dialogues.text: his eyes are open, his mouth is hanging in a SILENT SCREA It looks like his head is about to explode.  He lifts his hand up to his face.  He's holding an eight-inch long MON BUG. Jacob SCREAMS out loud this time, tosses the mutant insec away.  It lands on a windowsill and escapes out the openi Jacob jumps to his feet, sending his chair tumbling backw with a CRASH.  He shakes and moans, a little drool drippi down his chin. Wesley sits up with a start and stares at Jacob. WESLEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I told you you'd go nuts! Jacob catches his breath, gives Wes a dead serious look. JACOB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get everybody else.  I have to tell them  something. WESLEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the middle of the night? JACOB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I MEAN it! Wesley is shocked by Jacob's manic state and jumps out of bed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Five kids are gathered around the room in various stages sleepy grumpiness and annoyed disbelief.  Jacob paces bac and forth. SCOTT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't get it.  Is this guy alive or  dead? JACOB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's neither.  He haunts your dreams and  if he kills you, you die for real. Wesley, the most gullible of the group, looks pretty scar WESLEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I haven't dreamed of him. I have  nightmares like you wouldn't believe, but  never of this guy. SCOTT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's because this all rates an eleven  on the bullshit meter!  I don't know why  we have to listen to this crap.  You're  scaring the hell out of Wes here. GINA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Keep your voice down. SCOTT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It doesn't matter.  The Ross's sleep like  rocks, which is what we all should be  doing. JACOB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know this sounds crazy, but I swear  it's true.  I went to bed one night and  woke up in the middle of the road.   Freddy Krueger killed my mother, blasted  my whole town into his nightmare, and,  worst of all, I think he wants to use me  to kill more kids and bring more towns  into his world. KAREN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How? JACOB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not sure.  I think I'm some kind of  carrier.  He's somehow inside me and as  soon as I fall deep enough into sleep  he'll be let loose.  You guys were great  to take me in.  I just don't want to  thank you by getting you all killed. Scott gets up and goes to a desk.  He pulls out a map and shows it to Jacob. SCOTT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay.  Show me Springwood. Jacob looks at the map and points. SCOTT (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's nothing there. JACOB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's what I've been trying to tell you. SCOTT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's NEVER been a town there.   JACOB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's how YOU see it.  I was part of the  nightmare, so I'm the only one who  notices the difference. Scott stares at Jacob.  He actually grows sympathetic. SCOTT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, Jacob.  You don't have to convince  us that nightmares are real.  Everybody  in this room has been through one.  And  some of us are still living it.  But the  thing is, we know it's just in our heads  now.  It can be just as bad as the real  thing was, but it's still only a memory.   It can't hurt us physically, unless we do  the hurting ourselves. GINA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And we don't want to see you get hurt. WESLEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We know it gets crazy.  And we'll help  out the best we can. SCOTT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But this is just too hard to believe. Jacob plops down on the couch, defeated.  He hangs his he while the kids start to get up.  Wesley gives him a pat o the back as he, Scott, and Gina leave.  But Karen is stil here. She sits next to a window with a faraway look in her eyes Jacob looks up at her. JACOB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't believe me, either, do you? KAREN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know. JACOB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why are you still here? KAREN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not sure.  I guess, I guess I see a  lot of me in you. JACOB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Feels good to see someone more fucked up  than yourself, huh? Karen smiles and sits down next to him. KAREN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.  That must be it. JACOB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But you haven't told me why you're here  at this place. KAREN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't talk about it right now.  Maybe  later.  Do you want me to stay with you? JACOB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, that'd be great.  Don't let me  sleep, okay? KAREN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll do my best. She reaches for the remote control and flicks on the TV,  moving a little closer to Jacob when she sits back into t couch.  The two of them watch the screen with glassy eyes KAREN (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank God for cable TV. JACOB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.  Thank God. They continue to watch in silence as Karen takes hold of  Jacob's hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We are ON KAREN as she sleeps curled up on the couch.  Ja is in the background putting on his shoes.  He has a brow paper bag with him. Jacob gets up, grabs his bag, and steps over to Karen.  H gently pulls a lock of hair away from her face.  Then he  heads for the front door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jacob walks out the door and closes it behind him.  He  crosses to the porch steps and stops.  He has to hold ont porch column just to keep standing. Karen appears behind him.  Jacob jumps a bit. KAREN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where are you going? JACOB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm leaving. KAREN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why? JACOB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He can't hurt you if I'm gone.  Maybe  I'll go to the desert or something.  I'll  lie down in the middle of nowhere and  finally get some sleep.  Krueger can feed  of the dreams of snakes and vultures. KAREN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fine.  You're just going to take off  then... Karen has an angry expression on his face.  Jacob gives h pained look. JACOB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't do this to me.  I'm just trying to  protect you and the others. KAREN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right.  You blow into town and then blow  right out.  Terrific. JACOB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't understand why you're so mad at  me. KAREN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You just don't get it, do you? JACOB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get what? Karen, though still very angry, looks like she's about to cry.  Jacob, confused, sits down on the porch steps. JACOB (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe I'm crazy. KAREN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Running away doesn't help. He sighs and smiles a bit. JACOB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And you're going to convince me, huh? KAREN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe. This time Karen smiles.  Jacob looks at her and sighs.  T he yawns. KAREN (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm going to make some coffee.  You  promise not to move? JACOB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.  Sure. Karen jumps and heads back into the house.  Jacob stares the grass in front of him, his eyes heavy.

dialogues.speaker: THE LAWN
dialogues.text: A bush sits there doing nothing.  Until it suddenly comes LIFE.  Its leaves start to shrivel, the lawn turns brown, sky turns dark.  Everything changes and turns into

dialogues.speaker: DREAM FLASH
dialogues.text: We're in a different front yard in a different town, in a different dimension. The mutant bush starts to change, sprout legs, grow arms, become human.

dialogues.speaker: ALICE
dialogues.text: Her body takes shape as she reaches out a pleading arm to ALICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jacob!  Help me! She's fully formed now.  And Freddy bursts out from the  ground behind her.  He grabs Alice, reaches his knife arm around ALICE (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No-o-o-o-o! Her words are cut off as Krueger jams his blades in her g and we re-live her death once more.  But it's even worse time. Blood POURS from Alice like a burst fire hydrant, sprayin and showering the entire nightmare lawn like a human  sprinkler.  Freddy LAUGHS. FREDDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Say it, don't spray it, huh, Jacob?  Come  and join the fun! JACOB (O.S.)

dialogues.speaker: NOOOOOOO
dialogues.text: Jacob's voice rips through the scene as everything starts BLUR RED.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jacob is lying in the grass, violently shaking.  Karen dr down next to him. KAREN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jacob! JACOB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nooooo! His body jerks around as if caught in the throes of an  epileptic seizure.  He SHRIEKS, ignoring Karen completely and continues to shriek and scream and yell and shake.  L he's never going to stop.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're directly across the street from the Foster Home as  Jacob's cries echo through the neighborhood.  Mr. Hopkins opens the front door.  He sees what's going on, scowls, a yells into his house. MR. HOPKINS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I told you!  It's an overdose!  Jesus  Christ, I saw this coming.  Call 9-1-1! He watches the commotion growing across the street, and n once moves to help.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jacob is being strapped into a stretcher, babbling  incoherently.  The residents of the Foster Home stand off the side while neighbors gawk from the street.  Karen is to the AMBULANCE GUYS looking frantic. JACOB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No!  Don't let them take me! KAREN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jacob, it'll be alright. AMBULANCE GUY #1

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Calm down, kid.  We'll take care of you. Jacob grabs the Ambulance Guy. JACOB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't understand!  Let me go! The ambulance guy straps Jacob's arm down.  Mr. Ross grab Karen and pulls her away as they start loading the crazed teenager into the ambulance.  Scott shakes his head.  Wes looks terrified.  Gina keeps her distance from any human. Karen can't take it and runs into the house.  Mr. Ross  frowns. DAVID

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is just what we need. The ambulance drives away as the gathered crowd stares at kids angrily.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jacob yells and struggles as an Ambulance Guy prepares a  syringe for injection. JACOB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't fucking put me under!  You'll set  him free! The ambulance guy holds Jacob down and slams the needle h Jacob screams and his eyes start to glass over. JACOB (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He'll kill them all... Jacob's head starts to go limp.  A VOICE rings out in the van, a voice only Jacob hears: FREDDY (O.S.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Every town as an Elm Street! LAUGHTER echoes as Jacob turns his head towards a window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The ambulance zooms by.  All is quiet for a second until  CRASH! A twisted rusty sign post erupts out of the sidewa and settles at an ugly angle. It's an ELM ST. sign.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We PULL BACK from a wide awake Jacob, who is now suddenly alone in the van.  Outside the window there is only darkn Jacob twists and struggles on the stretcher as CLANG! the ambulance doors crash open revealing BLACKNESS KA-BOOM!  the stretcher is shot out of the van like a  cannonball.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The stretcher with Jacob BLASTS through a wall and starts race across the floor of the building that Jacob had been sweeping up the day before. It careens along, actually taking a few turns, like it ha mind of its own, heading for a shallow pit in the middle the warehouse. The stretcher hits the pit, drops a bit, swings up violen and stops in a vertical position like a rake that has bee stepped on AND A BLACK HUMAN SHAPE shoots out of Jacob's from intertial force, staying upright as it slides across floor, spins, stops, then changes into:

dialogues.speaker: FREDDY KRUEGER
dialogues.text: Freddy has his hands on his hips and a grin on his face. FREDDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks for the lift, kid! He saunters up to Jacob who is still strapped to the vert stretcher.  Krueger waves his knives and wiggles his tong JACOB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you want from me? FREDDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I already got it!  The rest I'm going to  get from your new little friends. JACOB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leave them alone! FREDDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's my duty to clean up the  neighborhood! JACOB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What have you done with my town? FREDDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aw, poor baby's homesick, isn't he?   Don't worry.  We'll all be one happy  family soon.  Wanna be the first recruit? Freddy raises his blades and SWINGS.  The straps around J drop away as his body falls to the floor.  He scrambles t his feet and starts to RUN. Freddy laughs

dialogues.speaker: WITH JACOB
dialogues.text: as he heads for a door.  Before he gets there, the door  swings open and Freddy leans casually in his way. FREDDY (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's the matter?  Don't want to be part  of my expansion project? Jacob turns right around and races back across the wareho

dialogues.speaker: AT THE DUMPSTER
dialogues.text: Jacob races around to the other side and there's Krueger  again. FREDDY (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Today, Rosedale.  Tomorrow, the world! JACOB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Over my dead body! FREDDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As you wish. Freddy cranks up his knives and looms over Jacob.  And th FLASHES OF LIGHT blast out behind the boy.  Jacob rolls a as Freddy holds up an arm to block the blinding glare.  T light fades.  The DREAM POLICE have arrived. We'll call the small one SOUND COP.  He stands there  motionless as a loud and horrible GROWING noise emanates his clenched teeth.  This guy's bark is worse than his bi The female in black is BLADE COP.  From nowhere she produ two nasty-looking knives, one in each hand.  She spins th blades in the air like an expert Samurai. The large one we'll call POWER COP.  He reaches out for t dumpster, and with one hand sends it tumbling away with a CRASH.  Freddy frowns. FREDDY (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh oh. Too many parking tickets. The Dream Police fan out around Krueger, surrounding him. Power Cop leaps at Freddy, grabs him and TOSSES him in th air.  Freddy tumbles, rolls and bounces right back up on feet.  Right next to BLADE. She swings her knives.  Freddy dodges.  Swings hi own bla at her.  She ducks.  Freddy spins again.  Right towards: SOUND COP.  The short man in black opens his mouth and a  sound like a foghorn at a rock concert BLARES OUT.  The f of it hitting Freddy like a fist. Freddy bounces back.  And once again he nimbly pops up. glares at the Dream Police. FREDDY (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't interfere! BLADE COP

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We have to. SOUND COP

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's our job. FREDDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get a new one. And Freddy starts to SPIN.  Slowly at first, then faster faster, until his image starts to BLUR. The Police circle the whirling image, holding back to see what will happen next.  Krueger stops spinning.  And his  clothes are different.  His red and green stripes have be replaced by black and white ones.  There is a number prin across his chest.  He's dressed like a CONVICT.  Freddy  grins. FREDDY (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Time to blow this joint. BOOM!  A hole is suddenly blown in the high ceiling above Krueger.  The building is suddenly filled with the beams moving SPOTLIGHTS and the sound of blasting SIRENS. A rope falls down through the hole.  Freddy grabs it and  WHOOSH! he's yanked up. FREDDY (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You'll never get me, coppers! and away he's gone.  After a few seconds the spotlights f away and the sirens die.  The Dream Police look up seemin unsure of their next action.  Then Power Cop kicks a pile lumber, sending wood flying dozens of yards away. POWER COP

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Goddamnit! Sound Cop shakes his head.  Blade looks frustrated.  Jaco steps up behind them. JACOB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alright...just who the hell are you guys? The black-clad trio turn around in unison and look at Jac There is a pause.  Then: BLADE COP

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're the Dream Police. Jacob almost laughs. JACOB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The what? POWER COP

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Dream Police.  Didn't you hear her,  man? Power Cop turns to Sound Cop and flips up his visor revea his face.  He's a sixteen-year old black boy.  Heavyset  features, sweat dripping down his cheeks.  He's KINCAID f NIGHTMARE 3.  And he's pissed. POWER COP (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We try and save this guy's ass and then  he goes off and cops an attitude. Sound Cop flips up his helmet.  He's JOEY, the former mut boy. SOUND COP

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think you're the wrong guy to talk  about attitudes. BLADE COP

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Guys, guys.  This is getting us nowhere. She takes her helmet completely off, long dark hair tumbl over her shoulders.  It's TARYN, the ex-junkie.  These th they're the Dream Warriors.  Or at least they used to be. JACOB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello?  May I butt in here and ask some  more stupid questions? The three of them stop bickering and turn to Jacob.  Blad walks up to Jacob.  Her two partners assume position behi her. BLADE COP

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We don't know much more than you do.   What we do know is that we've been  recruited... JACOB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: By who? SOUND COP

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We don't know. JACOB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why? BLADE COP

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think that's obvious. POWER COP

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The shit's about to hit the fan. SOUND COP

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Krueger's discovered new powers. BLADE COP

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's ripped a hole between dreams and  reality. POWER COP

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Our own powers have been amplified. SOUND COP

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We only hope it will be enough. BLADE COP

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But we're going to need your help. JACOB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Me?  What can I do?  Just who are you  guys...really? Blade puts her helmet back on.  Her face turns grim. BLADE COP

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We were like you.  We fought Freddy  Krueger many years ago.  Our souls were  released from his grip.  No we're back to  try again. All three of them drop their visors down at the same time JACOB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I still don't understand what... Jacob's voice starts to GARBLE. He keeps trying to talk b the words come out twisted and clipped.  He raises a hand his throat.  The hand is transparent.  Jacob looks at his body as it slowly starts to disappear and now he's comple mute. SOUND COP

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Freddy Krueger can't hurt us anymore. POWER COP

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because we're already dead. Jacob vanishes completely.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jacob opens his eyes.  He's in bed, dressed in a white sm A DOCTOR stands next to him with a clipboard in hand. JACOB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's going on? DOCTOR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just relax, everything's fine. JACOB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's what you say... DOCTOR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're lucky you're here instead of  juvenile hall.  You put up quite a fight.   But you're clean.  No traces of drugs or  alcohol in your blood. JACOB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I could've told you that. Jacob starts getting out of bed. DOCTOR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hold on there. JACOB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You said I was fine.  I have to get back.   My friends are in trouble. DOCTOR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I said you weren't on drugs, but I never  said you were fine.  You're suffering  from extreme fatigue and stress that  manifested itself into one hell of an  anxiety attack.  At least that's what we  hope it is.  You had a major seizure,  Jacob. JACOB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't understand.  This whole town is  in danger. DOCTOR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're keeping you here for observation.   You're not going anywhere tonight. JACOB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can't do that.  You don't have the  right! DOCTOR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes we do.  Your temporary guardian, Mr.  Ross, signed all the papers.  If you're  okay in the morning we might let you go  home.  Until then, you're bed bound. JACOB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But... DOCTOR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We took off the restraints.  Do you want  us to put them back on? Jacob drops back in bed.  The doctor goes to the door and turns out the lights. DAVID

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sleep. He closes the door behind him... JACOB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shit... and we hear it LOCK

dialogues.speaker: A CRAZED LUNATIC
dialogues.text: suddenly SCREAMING into the lens with desperation.  Dark  circles under bloodshot eyes, hair matted with sweat.  A not having a good day.  WE PULL BACK TO REVEAL: The man is tightly bound in a regulation straight-jacket tiny, claustrophobic holding cell.  We can now tell that image is in BLACK AND WHITE.  We continue PULLING BACK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gina sits on the couch with a stark white blanket on her watching a b&w 1940's potboiler with something less than  enthusiasm.  Wesley appears in the doorway, checking out source of the screaming.  He looks at Gina, who tosses th blanket aside and rises, frowning.  The lunatic on televi continues his blood-curdling SHRIEKS. GINA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nice movie, huh?  And I came in here to  mellow out. She smiles at Wes as she exits. GINA (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's all yours. Wesley murmurs a goodnight, then looks back at the screen

dialogues.speaker: ON THE TV
dialogues.text: Some orderlies enter the lunatic's cell and attempt to se him as he thrashes violently, SCREAMING bloody murder.  I gritty and awful but somehow riveting.

dialogues.speaker: WESLEY
dialogues.text: moves to the couch, clearly mesmerized by the scene.  He  curls up, absently pulling the white blanket around him a watches:

dialogues.speaker: ON THE TV
dialogues.text: The orderlies in the movie manage to get the needle into  their patient, who MOANS and SOBS pathetically. ORDERLY ON TV

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Relax, will ya, buddy? Everything's gonna  be just swell. The second orderly leans on a wall and pulls out a pack o cigarettes from the pocket of his scrubs.  (He bears a  suspicious resemblance to ROBERT ENGLUND.)

dialogues.speaker: WESLEY
dialogues.text: vaguely tenses at this and absently pulls the blanket mor tightly around him to compensate, like a cocoon.

dialogues.speaker: ON THE TV
dialogues.text: The second orderly smiles. SECOND ORDERLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, mac.  You've just had a hard day,  that's all. The orderly produces a pack of matches.  He goes to the  lunatic on the cot, and LIGHTS the match off the guy's  forehead.  As the match FLARES, the lunatic SCREAMS.

dialogues.speaker: WESLEY
dialogues.text: he shuts his eyes tensely as the SOUND is magnified, beco a sudden ROAR that fills the room. Wesley blinks his eyes open, looks around from his blanke cocoon.  Whatever that last sound was, it did NOT come fr the TV. Beads of sweat line his upper lip as he nervously glances about the room.  It remains quiet, serene.  Deciding it w his imagination reacting to the scene on TV, Wesley nestl back on the couch, laying down now as the CAMERA MOVES TO

dialogues.speaker: REVEAL
dialogues.text: The carpet at the edge of the room is bunched up as thoug the walls of the room itself have budged a few inches inw BACK ON THE TV the second orderly lights his cigarette as hands the pack to the first.  They both look down at the  madman as they savor their cigarettes.   ORDERLY ON TV

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You heard the man, Wesley.  Just relax.   Have a smoke with us. Wesley's brow furrows, reacting to the coincidence.  Then stiffens as the two orderlies in the movie begin to hold lit cigarettes over the lunatic's face SECOND ORDERLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, Wesley.  Have a smoke. OUR Wesley has seen about enough of this movie.  He start get up WESLEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuck this. but finds that he can't move.  The white blanket around h restraining him tightly like the straight-jacket on TV. squirms and struggles. WESLEY (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey. He struggles harder now, but to no avail.  He's wrapped  tight, like a cigarette. ON THE TV the two orderlies torment the straight-jacketed lunatic, poking his face with their lit cigarettes.  As t lunatic SCREAMS, the screams become magnified, again beco that loud, deafening ROAR we heard before.  Wesley squirm his blanket/ straight-jacket, he jerks his head around,  SEEING with each of the man's SCREAMS, the walls of the r SHUDDER INWARD and  Wesley's EYES WIDEN with horror as he realizes not only i TRAPPED like a sardine in his stark white blanket, but th walls of the room are starting to CLOSE IN on him.  He SP back to the TV set, where: The first orderly is now looking AT US.  Wesley REACTS as notices something familiar about the man's face. FIRST ORDERLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Relax, Wesley. WESLEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dad? The second orderly BOLTS into view.  He has become Freddy Krueger. FREDDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, Wesley.  Everything's gonna be  great!  Just have a smoke on us! As they hold their smokes out TOWARD US, their arms PROTR FROM THE TV SET with their lit cigarettes. Wesley SCREAMS and jerks his head away from TV and he HIT the floor with an ugly THUMP.  The wind knocked out of hi He rolls.  The couch is GONE. As he squirms and struggles to escape his white cocoon, t frightened boy looks around and sees that everything in t room - furniture, carpet, TV, even the door - are all gon leaving just the white walls SLOWLY CLOSING IN ON HIM. Then we see that on the floor all around Wesley are long, cylindrical white objects.  Clearly, they resemble GIANT  CIGARETTES, and Wesley - wrapped neck-to-toe in his white blanket cocoon - looks just like one of them. He continues to squirm and SCREAM as the walls CLOSE IN f all sides -- closer -- CLOSER -- pushing the long white  things toward him, around him, bunching them together unt they are in a tight cluster, as the room CRUNCHES IN TIGH blocking whatever light source there is, until all Wesley do is SCREAM one last time, and The screen goes BLACK. After a few beats, we hear a huge, deafening RIPPING SOUN and a new LIGHT SOURCE appears as  Wesley looks up, eyes with unspeakable horror as the giant, scarred face of FRE looms over him, grinning, and we:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The room is back to normal, but not the occupant.  Freddy Krueger now stands here alone.  He has just peeled the  wrapper off a pack of cigarettes of which Wesley has beco one. FREDDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Didn't Daddy ever tell you what the  Surgeon General says...? Krueger reaches in and pulls the tiny Wesley out of the p As before, Wesley is immobile, helpless.  Freddy holds hi between two fingers. FREDDY (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Smoking's bad for your health! Freddy looks around, as if searching for something, then  beams as he reaches into the air and... FREDDY (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ah!  A match made in heaven! He produces a puny version of WESLEY'S FATHER In one hand His body is straight and rigid, like a match stick. Freddy places his thumb on the stiff man's head, and flic his thumbnail, causing the man's skull to BURST INTO FLAM an evil grin spanning Wesley's Father's face. He brings the Father-Match to what would be Wesley's tiny feet, and lights the end.

dialogues.speaker: FREDDY'S HAND
dialogues.text: Wesley SCREAMS as Freddy tosses the FATHER-MATCH and brin the teenager's little head up to his fire-scarred lips. The boy is enveloped by the massive cracked opening as Fr takes a huge drag off of Wesley's head. Where his feet sh be, the tip of the Wesley-Cig GLOWS RED, causing Wesley t SCREAM with supernatural pain.  Smoke billows from Freddy nose and mouth.  He savors it. FREDDY (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ahhhh!  Now we're smokin'! He CACKLES horribly as he continues to suck on the Wesley Cig.  With each puff, Wesley's white-wrapped body becomes slat-black ash. FREDDY (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's your sign, Wesley?  It wouldn't be  Cancer, would it? In between his demonic CACKLES, Freddy DRAGS on the Wesle Cig, each puff turning more of Wesley into ash until all his head is black and charred.  Freddy holds the Wesley-C out, poised to tap the ashes loose. FREDDY (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now say the secret word and you know what  you'll win... WESLEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go to hell! Freddy grins. FREDDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right... And he taps the Wesley-cig with his finger.  The ashes  immediately fall, sifting in the air as Wesley's head -  charred and black at the neck where it's been separated - falls loose.  Wesley SCREAMS. WESLEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Noooooooo! and his severed head falls and falls and falls.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WE START on WESLEY'S BODY.  Eyes closed, head normal and  everything from the neck down charred mass of burnt torso shriveled limbs, all wrapped in the scorched blanket.  ZI A body bag hides this ghastly image from us as we PULL BA A FIRE MARSHALL and a COP are talking at the doorway in t background.  The CORONER is here, a world weary seen-it-a older guy, with his nervous ASSISTANT who's never seen  anything like this.  They whisper their conversation as t lift the body bag onto a stretcher. ASSISTANT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't get it.  The couch is barely  scorched.  And how can he burn from just  the neck down? CORONER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It happens. ASSISTANT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It happens?  That's your explanation? CORONER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've seen worse. We FOLLOW them as they push the stretcher towards the  doorway. ASSISTANT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?  What worse? CORONER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Never mind. Our shot STOPS at the doorway with the fire Marshall and while the wigged-out assistant's voice trails off outside ASSISTANT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.  I wanna know.  Really.  What could  be worse than... FIRE MARSHALL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know what the gossip rags are going  to say?  Spontaneous human combustion. COP

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's that? FIRE MARSHALL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's where bodies are supposed to go up  in smoke for no reason.  It's all psychic  bullshit.  What really happened is called  the candle effect.  A tiny fire gets  started, usually from a cigarette.  It  slowly smolders through the blanket and  clothes until the skin starts to actually  bake.  The body fat begins to melt and  liquefy, fueling the fire like a slow  burning candle.  It takes hours, but it's  real. The cop makes some notes.  Behind them we see Scott, Kare and Gina.  The girls have been crying, and even tough-guy Scott looks pretty screwed up by all this.  The cop nods. COP

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He fell asleep while smoking.  What a  waste. The kids shoot unbelieving looks at each other as the two walk off. SCOTT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's impossible. Scott and Karen head for the front door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A coroner's van, a fire chief's car and the now familiar of suspicious neighbors are gathered around the front of house as the stretcher with Wesley's body is put away.  A small van marked ROSEDALE GENERAL HOSPITAL pulls up and J jumps out of it. Jacob's face turns grim as a tearful Karen runs up to him Scott following. JACOB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who? KAREN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wes... JACOB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh my God.  It's started. SCOTT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He fucking burned alive. KAREN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They said he fell asleep smoking. SCOTT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And we all know that can't be. JACOB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I already told you how it would happen. Mr. Ross appears behind the three teenagers, a wasted loo his face. SCOTT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't start with that shit. JACOB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's not shit. DAVID

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: C'mon, kids.  Everyone inside.  Now. David leads them back to the house as the coroner's van p away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jacob, Scott, Karen and Gina stand around in various stat of utter shock as David tries to console them. DAVID

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We have to be strong. He puts an arm around Karen and reaches out to put the ot one around Gina, but pulls away at the last minute when s starts to flinch. DAVID (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We need to pull together and help each  other.  Mrs. Ross is upstairs in bed.   She's pretty messed up.  We need to help  her deal with this. SCOTT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He would never touch a cigarette.  You  know that. DAVID

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We don't know anything until the  authorities are finished with their  investigation.  In the mean time, no work  for tomorrow - three day weekend.  But  Monday, it's back on the job.  Jacob  wasn't covered in our health plan and his  little stint at the hospital cost us a  bundle.  We have to work together or we  might lose this place.  Okay? The kids all nod, but not convincingly.  They care more a Wesley than the house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jacob closes the door.  All the kids are here.  Gina  absentmindedly plays with some of Wesley's things. JACOB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When I was put under, Freddy was  released.  I know this because I dreamed  it. SCOTT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And that dream was real? JACOB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.  Wesley was his first victim. SCOTT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aw, man... JACOB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You said it yourself.  How could it have  been a cigarette? KAREN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And how could he...dire that way and not  wake up? GINA (mockingly)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe the "authorities" will figure it  out. SCOTT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry.  I just can't buy into this. JACOB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Call me crazy...but I think he's after  Rosedale.  The whole place.  In my dream  he said something about needing a few  souls to get the job done. I think he has  to kill in order to get the power to suck  in a new town. SCOTT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You are crazy. JACOB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you.  There's more.  There are... other people in there.  In the  nightmares. KAREN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Like him? JACOB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. Different.  There are three of them.   They're dressed in black. They have  powers like Freddy, but they seem to be  on our side. KAREN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who are they? JACOB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, you gotta hang in there with me on  this one.  They call themselves... the  Dream Police. Scott actually laughs. SCOTT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is too much. GINA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You mean...like cops? JACOB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
