dialogues.text: I guess.  KAREN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where are they from? JACOB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're kids that Freddy killed years  ago.  THEY don't even know how they got  there.  But they're somehow patrolling  dreamworld to put a stop to Krueger. SCOTT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then why haven't these guys done the job  already? JACOB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They say they need help.  I don't know  what or why...yet. SCOTT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can tell you who needs help. JACOB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, I'm trying to save all of us. SCOTT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I won't believe it until I see it. Jacob is crushed that he's not getting through to them. JACOB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: By then it'll be too late.  It was too  late for Wesley. The kids stare emptily at Wesley's earthly possessions.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jacob and Karen sit on the steps.  Across the street we c see window curtains part as Mr. Hopkins sneaks a wary pee KAREN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're going to use all this to shut us  down. JACOB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know.  It's my fault. KAREN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You going to try to run away again? JACOB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's too late for that. I have to stay  and try and put a stop to it. KAREN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry.  It's all so hard to accept. JACOB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wish I could convince you of the danger  you and the others are in. KAREN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've been in danger before. THAT I can  handle. JACOB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is worse than anything you can  imagine. KAREN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wouldn't be so sure about that.  Come  on.  Let's go inside. She stands up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jacob and Karen lie in bed, clothes on, cozy.  Not sexual She stares at the ceiling while he listens. KAREN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She was great. Loving.  Supportive,  caring - everything a mom should be.  Except she had one fatal flow: my father.   You see, she was raised at a time when  they still had the "obey" part in the  wedding vows.  He was always jealous.   She couldn't talk to another man without  him thinking she wanted to go to bed with  him.  He never hit me. But the things he  did to her...and she would always just  take it.  She never fought back.  He'd  get drunk and...she'd tell people she  just fell down or something.  Then one  night...I was thirteen.  Something  happened.  My mom suddenly wouldn't take  it anymore.  Something made her say  enough is enough.  She hit back.  Tat  only made it worse.  I watched as he hit  her over and over.  Then he knocked her  down the stairs.  She broke her neck.   And when y father saw what he'd done - he  finally became human.  He cried over her  body for a while, then went into the  garage and blew his brains out with a  shotgun.  To this day I don't remember  what that final straw was.  The shrinks  say I've blocked it out of my memory.   There's no one else alive who knows what  really happened.  I have dreams about it  sometimes, but there's always that blank  spot.  A missing piece. She stops and closes her eyes.  Jacob closes his eyes for second also - feeling her pain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jacob opens his eyes and touches Karen's arm.  She finall turns to him. JACOB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry. KAREN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know nightmares are real, Jacob.  I  know. JACOB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So did my mom.  She taught me a lot about  dreams. KAREN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Like what? JACOB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She told me that a lot of people have  special dream powers.  I inherited some  from her - and some I have all to myself.   She showed me how I could link up with  other people's dreams - to actually be  inside with them. KAREN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That sounds wonderful.  But...I don't  know... JACOB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A little hard to imagine, huh? KAREN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.  I'm sorry. JACOB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can convince you. KAREN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How? JACOB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Easy.  We're doing it now. Jacob smiles, gets up and walks over to the bedroom door. Karen is confused. KAREN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you mean? JACOB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I mean we're dreaming.  You and me.   Together. He opens the bedroom door.  And there's a FOREST OUTSIDE. Karen is a little scared at first, totally blown away by  what's happening.  But then she stands up and smiles. JACOB (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Want to go for a walk? Karen steps up next to him and they walk through the door into daylight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shafts of sunlight filter through as leaves flutter down the towering trees and Jacob and Karen step out of the  bedroom door. KAREN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't believe it. JACOB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's true.  We're really doing it. KAREN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But what if I'm just dreaming of you  telling me that? JACOB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'll compare notes when we wake up.   Then you'll know. Karen looks around.  Then she giggles.  She likes this a Karen suddenly runs away into the trees like an excited  little girl.  Jacob frowns. JACOB (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Karen.  Wait. He heads off after her.

dialogues.speaker: AMONGST THE TREES
dialogues.text: Jacob runs.  Karen jumps out from behind a tree and laugh JACOB (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You have to be careful. KAREN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you bring us here on purpose?  Can  you go anywhere you want? JACOB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sometimes.  It's not as easy as linking  up, though. KAREN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wow, I never knew... She starts wandering off again.  Jacob follows her. KAREN (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know what I like to do in my dreams? She ducks behind a tree.  And comes out suddenly dressed sharp BUSINESSWOMAN.  Jacob is slightly taken aback. KAREN (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I like to be other people! Jacob grins as she steps behind another tree - and a FIRE walks out in her place.  Jacob is really taken aback this time. KAREN (cont'd) (as fireman)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can be anybody I want. JACOB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Show off. Karen slips past another trunk and comes out as a tall  VOLUPTUOUS REDHEAD. KAREN (AS REDHEAD)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When things get bad it helps to be  someone else.  I use it to protect  myself.   The redhead walks seductively towards Jacob.  He raises h eyebrows as she slinks right up next to him - her ample  cleavage inches away from his nose. KAREN (cont'd) (as redhead)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you think? JACOB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think I like you the way you always  are. He smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And now Karen is herself again.  They're still very close JACOB (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Much better. They look like they're about to kiss... but Karen suddenl sees something that grabs her attention. KAREN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look! Jacob turns as Karen runs over to ANOTHER DOOR.  It's not one to the bedroom.  It just hangs there in space between trees. KAREN (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wonder where it goes? She reaches for the knob and opens it.   JACOB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Karen, no! But she's already stepped through.  Jacob runs up to the  doorway and it SLAMS in his face.  Jacob tries to open th door.  It doesn't budge.  He keeps twisting the knob to n effect. JACOB (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Karen! Jacob starts to pound on the door as we:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sixties style decore, appliances that look about twenty-f years old -- not the Foster Home kitchen at all.  Karen i standing in the middle of the room, completely disoriente She walks across to a counter top where she finds a frame picture. It's a picture of HER, Karen, age thirteen.  Karen sets t picture down and quickly walks back to the door she came

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Karen steps out of her old kitchen expecting, hoping to b back in the forest again.  Nope.  She blinks.  Then she  starts to walk down the corridor.  More pictures on the wall this time.  One of a WOMAN and  another of a MAN (Karen's MOM and DAD). Karen's sure of it now.  She's home.  The center of her w nightmares.  She creeps along to the main stairs.  And th when the NOISES begin.  A thumping from upstairs.  A CRAS like something hit the floor above.  More thumping,  repeatedly and then human MOANING, the sound of pain. Somebody is getting beaten. KAREN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh no... Something is twisting deep inside the girl.  Her face goe shallow as she slowly shuffles around to the foot of the  stairs...and starts to climb them.

dialogues.speaker: ON THE STAIRS
dialogues.text: Karen goes up, step by painful step, as the sounds of the BEATING increase in their intensity.  Every hit seems to  touch Karen as she flinches.  She's afraid to go on - but can't seem to stop.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Karen slowly heads for a door at the end, nervously reach out for the knob.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Karen opens the door.  What she thought she was going to was bad enough - but this is worse: Freddy Krueger is in the middle of the room.  In front of is a giant human-sized version of an inflatable punching  doll, the kind little kids hit that keep bouncing back. the doll doesn't have the image of a clown on it. It's a flattened wrapped-around version of KAREN'S MOTHER pitiful beat-up look on her plastic face.   Freddy SMACKS the doll - it falls to the floor - and just bounces back up.  And now the face on it has a NEW BRUISE THWACK!  He hits it again, CACKLING with glee.  Swoop,  bounce.  More bruises develop.  Krueger looks at Karen. FREDDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Welcome to Romper Room! BAP!  BOOOOING!  The face on the punching doll changes ag it's even sadder now.  And it's looking at Karen. KAREN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why are you doing this? FREDDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't you remember? ZING!  Krueger whips up his finger knives.  SWOOP!  he RI them through the plastic doll.  SISSSSSssss.  The doll st to deflate.  SKREEEEeeeee.  The escaping air sounding lik human SCREAM.  Freddy turns to Karen. And a HAND reaches out from behind her and pulls her out the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jacob pulls Karen away from the door and slams it shut. H grabs her hand. JACOB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on! They turn to run down the hallway, and it's CHANGED.  The are now NO DOORS and NO STAIRWAY.  The only way out is th bedroom door they just closed.  They stop and Jacob turns Karen. JACOB (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wake up! KAREN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? JACOB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You heard me.  I said wake up! KAREN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How?  This is my old house.  How did I  get here?  He begins to shake her.  She is confused and disoriented. CRASH is heard at the bedroom door.  FREDDY'S COMING. And Jacob HITS Karen.  Nothing major.  It's a good slap,  nonetheless.  She stares at him unbelievingly.  He WHACKS again. KAREN (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why are you doing this to me? JACOB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is a dream!  You have to get out of  here.  I'm not hurting you, only he can  really do that!  Wake up now! SLAP!  Karen's getting angry.  She doesn't know what she' supposed to do.  KA-BLAM!  Freddy blasts through the door a shower of splinters.  He sees them and grins. FREDDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gettin' kinky, huh? Jacob turns to Karen, raises his hand.  KA-BLAM!  Somethi blasts through the wall across from them.  It's POWER COP CRASH!  The other wall explodes.  BLADE appears in the  rubble. BOOM!  A piece of wall falls down at the end of the corri SOUND COP steps through. Karen looks at all this nonsense, then at Jacob. KAREN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think I get it now. She closes her eyes and DISAPPEARS out of Jacob's hands. DREAM POLICE stand in the hallway.  Freddy just puts his  hands on his hips and LAUGHS at them. Then Krueger lays his arms flat on his sides, takes a dee breath and begins to INFLATE.  His body expands, his clot and skin stretch and flatten.  The bottom half of him get fatter. He turns into a giant FREDDY PUNCHING DOLL. Power Cop jumps in front of the plastic horror and lets l a devastating swing.  POW!  The Freddy Doll swings back a BOUNCES right up again.  POW POW POW POW POW!  The big Dream Cop pummels away at t Krueger toy as it slaps back and forth between the floor his fist until SHINK!  Two knives appear in Blade's hands SWOOP.  She swings them out. RIP!  The Freddy Doll tears, air blasting out in a gratin SHRIEK which screeches and hisses until it becomes: Freddy's LAUGH.  The red and green plastic flutters to th ground as the evil guffaws fade away and we:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Karen shakes Jacob awake.  His eyes open.  They stare at other for a few beats, then Karen frowns. KAREN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You hit me. JACOB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you hurt? KAREN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Um...no. JACOB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If he had done it, you'd be dead.   Karen is confused.  She doesn't know what to make of all  this.  She looks at a clock.  It's late. KAREN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You better get back to your room.  We  don't want anybody to get the wrong idea. JACOB (smirks)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Or the right one? Karen finally relaxes.  She smiles and playfully pushes h KAREN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get out of here. Jacob reaches under a pillow and pulls something out.  It the framed photo of Karen, age thirteen - from her dream. hands it to her and she looks at it in astonishment. JACOB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's something else my mom taught me. He gets up and goes to the door, turning back to her. JACOB (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't sleep. KAREN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.  Not tonight. She holds the picture tightly- staring at it with those  faraway eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Scott comes out of the bathroom in his night clothes, the toilet flushing in the B.G.  He goes into his room, but s at the doorway when he hears Karen's door open. Scott ducks behind his door as he watches Jacob leave Kar room and head for his own.  Scott frowns.  His is not  pleased.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: David Ross is sifting through some mail when a heated  conversation in the kitchen catches his interest.  He sto to listen.

dialogues.speaker: IN THE KITCHEN
dialogues.text: Karen is finally convinced, Jacob and Scott are looking l they're ready to punch each other, and Gina looks scared. KAREN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm telling you, this Freddy guy is for  real. SCOTT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And I'm telling you a dream is a dream. KAREN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jacob was in there with me. SCOTT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And where else was he with you last  night? JACOB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the hell is that supposed to mean? KAREN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have the picture in my room if you want  to see it.  He brought it out from the  nightmare. SCOTT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Or from your hope chest.  I bet your bed  isn't the only thing he's been into. KAREN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That picture was destroyed years ago. JACOB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You better watch your mouth, pal. SCOTT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm the last person you want to start  fucking with. JACOB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go ahead and be a tough guy, Scott.   Krueger will cut you to pieces before you  can even flex a muscle. GINA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will you two stop it!  You're scaring the  shit out of me. KAREN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You should be scared. Mr. Ross enters the room, none too pleased. DAVID

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alright.  What's going on here? SCOTT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Join the fun.  Jacob and Karen were just  telling us about their new excuse to  sleep together. JACOB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing happened between us last night. SCOTT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You mean in plain old reality, right? DAVID

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, everybody.  Out.  Jacob and I are  going to have a little talk.  Now. Scott, Gina and Karen grudgingly leave the room.  David t to Jacob. DAVID (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your days are numbered here, buster. JACOB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry, but... DAVID

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, I don't know what kind of shit  you're shoveling to these kids, but it's  going to stop.  My Good Samaritan  instincts have their limits.  We've had  enough tragedy around this place.  We  don't need you making things worse with  fantasies. JACOB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't understand DAVID

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And I want you to stay away from Karen. Jacob starts to get defiant.  JACOB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a free country. DAVID

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This isn't America, it's my house.  I've  been checking up on you.  You have no  record with the police or the state or  any of the runaway groups.  You're the  invisible kid.  And if I sense even a  little bit more trouble-making from you,  you're going to vanish from here.  Got  it? JACOB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, sir. David catches his breath.  He looks like he wants to say  more, but doesn't have the energy left.  He just walks ou the room leaving a frustrated Jacob.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. and Mrs. Ross are getting into their car.  The engine starts and they drive away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jacob sits in bed, staring into space.  Karen quietly ent the room, carefully shutting the door behind her. She sits down next to him.  Jacob looks at her with weary eyes. JACOB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're supposed to be off-limits to me. KAREN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's okay.  The Ross's have gone to a  council meeting and Scott's in his room.   We should be safe for awhile. JACOB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wonderful. KAREN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jacob, what are we going to do? JACOB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm going to go to bed soon. KAREN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now you WANT to sleep? JACOB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have to find the Dream Police.  I think  I'm somehow their link to all this.  They  only seem to appear when I'm around.  You  woke me up before I had a chance to talk  to them last night. KAREN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry.  I was scared. JACOB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: your fault.  I have to ask them what  we're supposed to do to help them.  And  maybe I can protect Gina while I'm in  there. KAREN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about Scott? JACOB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's on his own. KAREN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh... JACOB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't mean to be cold,but we've done  everything to convince him.  Gina's too  scared to understand.  I think Freddy  will go after her next. KAREN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What should I do? JACOB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You have to stay awake. KAREN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's not going to be easy.  I'm half  asleep already. JACOB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You have to try. She nods her head quietly.  Then KAREN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'd better get out of here. JACOB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay.  Be careful. KAREN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: YOU be careful.  I'm not going anywhere. She kisses him quickly on the cheek.  He needed that.  Ka gets up and quietly leaves.  Jacob yawns

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gina sits on her bed in her night clothes.  She holds a d of cards in one hand while she plays solitaire on her bed sheets. She flips a card from her deck: A black nine.  She puts i top of a ten.  Another card.  Queen of diamonds.  She lay on top of a king of clubs.  Gina yawns.  Takes another ca It's the Freddy of Spades. Gina frowns.  Freddy Krueger's image stares up at her fro the card.  She looks at her stacks.  There's no place to this one.  She starts flipping through the deck of cards, trying to see if there are any more Freddys.  That's when HAND RIPS UP through the bed and grabs her arm.   Gina SCREAMS, pulls away from the hand's grip and jumps b up on the bed.  And ANOTHER HAND shoots up from a pillow grabs her shoulder.  Gina twists. RIP.  TEAR.  GRAB.  More hands appear out of the mattress lunging for any part of Gina's body as she SHRIEKS from t touch.  And Gina jumps out of bed. She leaps to the other side of the room, bumping against dresser drawers.  Turns to her bed. SWOOP.  The multiple hands disappear down into the mattre There is a quiet beat as she catches her shivering breath Then a half-dozen ARMS AND HANDS pop out from the drawers next to her.  Latching indiscriminately.  Some grabbing h legs and arms.  Some grabbing more intimate parts. Gina SCREAMS.  Pulls away from the dresser.  Yanks a few  drawers out as the hands vanish and she spins over to ano wall. Where the wall ERUPTS with outreaching arms all around he Two grab her hair.  Three on each arm.  Her legs are pinn Gina shrieks and yells and flays her arms.  Beating the h with her fists as two grabs her breasts viciously.  She  starts kicking as one particularly perverse hand BURNT AN SCARRED, pops out between her legs.  Aiming right for her crotch and in an incredible show of strength, the girl pu away from the horde. Gina heads for the door.  CRASH.  Hands blast up from the wood floor.  She leaps around them.  CRASH.  More hands t to block her way. Gina jumps around like she's in a mine field made of hot  coals.  She finally reaches to door and flings it open.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gina hits the lift's opposite wall having expected it to hallway.  The elevator's doors close on her bedroom and s turns to see: Freddy.  A razor finger poised over the elevator's button He smiles politely. FREDDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Going up? Gina is shocked and speechless.  She backs away into a co like someone trapped in a closet with the devil.  Which i exactly what she is. Rising past the terror is Gina's realization that everyth Jacob's been saying is true. FREDDY (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At your service. He punches one of the buttons and the elevator LURCHES. grabs onto a wall as the lift races up and Freddy actuall begins to WHISTLE nonchalantly. GINA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're not real! FREDDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ah, but who is? The elevator begins to slow. FREDDY (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fourth floor.  Overpopulation. The elevator stops.  The doors begin to open.  Gina leaps the way out.  But she's blocked. Blocked by PEOPLE.  They fill the entrance to the lift an start to pile in.  All kinds of people: businessmen, nurs plumbers.  And they're all ZOMBIES. Vacant expressions fill their dark hollow eyes as the zom keep coming in.  Pushing Gina back into the elevator.   Filling it to capacity and beyond. The doors close and the elevator starts to move up.  Twen bodies are crammed into the tiny enclosure, smashed toget surrounding the poor teenager, drool oozing out of their  mouths, breathing down her neck.  SMASHING her so hard sh can't even yell for help.  Gina turns her head. WESLEY is pressed up next to her.  A very dead look on hi face.  Begin squeezed by the zombies around him.  One of eyes POPS out of its socket. Gina finds the breath to scream and scream and scream. FREDDY (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eight floor - the morgue.   The elevator doors open and the mass of zombies starts to spastically pile out.  Gina, having only been held up by crushing bodies, falls to her knees as the last of the  monsters exit the lift.  She breathes in ripping gasps li she's having a coronary.  But she sees the open door.  An Gina jumps for the exit. Freddy grabs her shoulder and pulls her back violently. falls to the floor again as the doors shut.  Freddy waves fingers down the row of buttons and stops above the very  bottom one.  This button doesn't looks like the others.   It's in the shape of a little heart. Freddy turns and gives Gina a frighteningly serious look. FREDDY (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Time to go down, Gina. He presses the heart button.  And the floor disappears. falls SCREAMING into blackness as Freddy hangs in mid-air

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gaudy colors, mirrors, a cheesy heart-shaped bed.  Gina's body drops down, unexpectedly softly, landing on the fluf satin sheets. she's dressed in a skimpy piece of bright pink LINGERIE. moans and tries to sit up. And four snake-like strips of satin swoop out from under bed and quickly wrap around each of her limbs, pulling he down and yank her tight. She's trapped.  That's when the door to the room opens an walks an incredibly huge FAT MAN.  He barely fits through door as he closes it behind him.  Puffy cheeks, permanent seat, dirty fingernails, and a lecherous smile. Gina's eyes widen. FAT MAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi there, princess.  Your mom's told me  all about you. Gina SCREAMS as he approaches her, the ground actually  shaking from his weight. FAT MAN (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She said you're even better than she is. He looms above her, now.  Starts to unbutton his shirt to reveal a hideous mound of hairy stomach flesh.  Gina is  repulsed. FAT MAN (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aw, come on.  I'm really a nice guy.  You  know what they say.  Inside every fat  person... RIP! Krueger's finger blades JUT out of the abdomen ad st tearing a huge SLIT up the front of his body.  The Fat Ma starts to fold back as Freddy's head pops out of the fron FREDDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...is a maniac trying to get out! Freddy steps out of the Fat Man, sluffing the bulbous rem aside.  He towers over Gina.  That creepy serious look on face again. FREDDY (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now it's time for YOU to put out, Gina. Gina gasps in horror as Krueger moves in.  But then a KNO at the door.   ROOM SERVICE (O.S.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Room service? FREDDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Huh?  I didn't order anything... Freddy frowns and walks over to the door.  He turns back Gina.  FREDDY (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe its complimentary champagne! Krueger opens the door.  On the other side is a dinner ca and a waiter behind it.  The waiter is JACOB. CRASH!  Jacob shoves the dinner cart into the room and in Freddy's gut, shoving Krueger across the room into a tumb heap.  Three EXPLOSIONS OF LIGHT BURST into the room.  Th Dream Police materialize. Freddy jumps up growling.  Power Cop grabs him from behin Blade leaps over to the bed and in a FLASH of steel, rele Gina from her satin bonds.  Jacob yanks Gina off the bed pulls her towards the door. JACOB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on! Freddy jumps out of Power Cop's grip and the Dream Police surround him as the two teenagers bolt out of the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jacob pulls Gina along as the hotel room door SLAMS shut itself.  Gina yells at Jacob. GINA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let go of me! She squirms out of Jacob's grip and bounces away from him like he has the plague.  CRASHING is heard from the hotel room.  A violent battle is under way.  Jacob pleads with  Gina. JACOB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm here to help! He holds out his hand to her.  Gina shivers, than looks i Jacob's sincere eyes.  SOUNDS of destruction continue beh the door as the girl battles with her worst fear.  Finall Gina takes Jacob's hand. GINA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's get out of here. They start running down the corridor - together.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The entire room is filled with SWIRLING DUST and SMOKE,  completely obscuring everything from sight.  As the sound BREAKING FURNITURE and grunting fighters echoes, a few pi of debris bounce into view. And then there is SILENCE. The dust settles and the smoke dissipates.  The DREAM POL stand alone in the rubble of a totally trashed room. POWER COP

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where'd he go? SOUND COP

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought you had him.  BLADE COP

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shit... Krueger has escaped.

dialogues.speaker: HOTEL CORRIDOR
dialogues.text: Jacob runs, Gina trailing behind him, the two of them try to find a way out.  They pass a door. The door SLAMS open and Freddy reaches out, grabs Gina an yanks her into the room.  The door BANGS shut. Jacob twirls around and runs towards the door. And the door DISAPPEARS.  Nothing but flat wall remains a Jacob hits it.  He starts banging his fist against the si of the corridor. JACOB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No no no no! The Dream police run up next to him.  Jacob spins around  angry. JACOB (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's got Gina! SOUND COP

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stand back. Everyone backs off.  Sound Cop opens his mouth.  BOOM!  A almost visible sound wave bursts forth from his lips and  CRACK, a huge hole is punched in the wall. The Police leap into the hole, quickly followed by Jacob.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This one's pretty normal.  Maybe the business suite.  And it's EMPTY except for a heart-shaped box of candy in the  middle of the bed.  Jacob and the rest of the Police watc Blade picks up the box and opens it.  Dozens of COCKROACH pour out onto the floor.  Now Jacob's really pissed. JACOB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You let him get away! SOUND COP

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's difficult. POWER COP

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's been at this longer than we have. BLADE COP

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He can do anything. SOUND COP

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But we have to catch him in the act to  get him. JACOB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What...there are rules to all this? SOUND COP

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're not rules. POWER COP

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's just the way it is. BLADE COP

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jacob, we need you to bring the rest  together. JACOB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The rest?  You mean the kids at the home? BLADE COP

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.  We need as many of you as we can  get.  And you must bring them to  Springwood. JACOB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How? BLADE COP

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You have the power to link your dreams  with other's.  Dream of Springwood, then  bring the rest with you. SOUND COP

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Living souls are what he thrives on.   Living souls are what we need to help  stop him. POWER COP

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Before it's too late. BLADE COP

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Before he takes everyone. SOUND COP

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And every THING. Jacob just shakes his head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All is BLACK.  Except for Freddy and Gina.  He has her fr behind, his hands locked on her shoulders. FREDDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ah...alone at last. Gina cries horribly like a person who knows death is seco away.  Freddy wraps his arms around her, hugging her. And he KEEPS wrapping his arms.  They STRETCH and elongat wrapping once around his body and then around her's again And then again.  Freddy's rubber limbs curl around and ar an around Gina's quivering body.  Spiraling up and down. Encircling on all sides on every part of her, touching an grabbing her EVERYWHERE. Until Krueger's arms cover her entirely.  Gina whimpers. FREDDY (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Touching, isn't it? And he starts to SQUEEZE.  Gina gags as Freddy's snake-li embrace TIGHTENS around her, draining the life out of Gin body.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jacob wakes with a start as the entire house around him  shakes. JACOB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gina! Jacob jumps out of bed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jacob dashes down the corridor.  Karen comes out of her r KAREN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is it an earthquake? JACOB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.  It's Freddy. They run to Gina's room and fling the door open.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The RUMBLING of the house has stopped.  Gina's in bed, he tongue sticking grotesquely out from the corner of her mo her skin completely blue.  Jacob and Karen run to her to and help. Gina's already dead.  But Freddy's not quite done with he yet.  Jacob and Karen watch as Gina's chest CAVES IN.  Ka SCREAMS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The coroner's back, the neighborhood gawks.  Jacob, Karen Scott sit on the front steps in a daze. But this time there are police barricades up.  In another part of the front yard we can see Mr. and Mrs. Ross with social worker, MR. SILVERMAN.  Mary Ross is crying while husband David is having a heated argument with Silverman. The kids watch on gloomily. The social worker leaves as Mr. Ross walks over to the ki Mary walks right by them and into the house - to broken u over something to talk. DAVID

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pack your bags, kids. JACOB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're kicking us out? DAVID

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.  They're taking you away.  They say  it's for your own good. KAREN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They can't do that. DAVID

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, they can.  They consider Mary and I  possibly unfit to act as foster parents.   They're going to find temporary homes for  you until this mess is straightened out.   I'm so very sorry. Karen runs up to David and hugs him desperately.  He hold her. KAREN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, please. DAVID

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're not calling it an accident this  time.  They don't really know what to  call it. Karen lets go.  Scott stands up. SCOTT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's going to happen to us? DAVID

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You'll be alright. KAREN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's going to happen to you? DAVID

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know.  They're thinking of  pressing charges.   JACOB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aw, Jesus... DAVID

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on.  A car from juvenile hall will  be here in an hour. He leads them up the stairs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A sign reads: ROSEDALE YOUTH CENTER.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Silverman, the social worker, is talking to the  teenagers.  Karen and Scott look understandably worried. Jacob looks like the world just ended for him. MR. SILVERMAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sure most of you know how this works  already.  You'll be assigned new foster  homes tomorrow afternoon.  Tomorrow  morning the police will be talking to you  regarding the matter at the old house. KAREN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about it? MR. SILVERMAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anything you know. SCOTT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are we considered suspects? MR. SILVERMAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You'll talk to the police about that.   Don't worry.  We'll all try and work this  out. KAREN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will we be able to go back to the Ross's? MR. SILVERMAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know.  You'll have a place to  stay in the mean time. KAREN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will we be together? MR. SILVERMAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.  We don't have anybody willing to  take more than one person.  I'm afraid  you'll be split up. SCOTT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Great... MR. SILVERMAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, you can visit each other.  You'll be  in the same town. JACOB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If it's still here. Silverman frowns at that last comment as the kids get up leave.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The teenagers walk glumly out of the office.  Jacob is st strangely silent, not making eye contact with anyone. KAREN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jacob, what are we going to do? JACOB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing. KAREN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you mean, nothing? JACOB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's over.  We're finished.  He's won. Jacob walks on ahead of them.  Karen is flabbergasted.  S stops and just stands there with Scott.  The two of them  watching Jacob walk away. SCOTT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Looks like your hero just gave up. And Karen still can't believe it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jacob is sitting on a bench looking like a beaten man and hating himself for it. Karen and Scott step out of a door.  They watch him for a seconds.  Then Karen walks towards Jacob.  Scott stays be and lights up a cigarette. KAREN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How can you do this? JACOB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do what?  I'm not doing anything. KAREN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Exactly.  After all we've been through  you just throw in the towel.  Why? JACOB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because we're fucked.  The last thing the  Dream Police told me was that they needed  all our help.  Together.  Even if we  weren't about to be split up there aren't  enough of us left to make a difference. KAREN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How do you know that? JACOB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't.  But, it's all just too much.   I've tried so hard and nothing's worked.   I'm spent.  I'm wasted.  I'm...I'm so  tired. Jacob puts his face in his hands. JACOB (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've had enough. KAREN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So you're just going to give up?  I'll  bet that's something your mother never  taught you. That hit home.  Jacob uncovers his face.  His ID bracelet dangles from his wrist.  He looks at the bracelet.  ALICE glints in the setting sunlight.  He remembers.  Jacob loo up at Karen. KAREN (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We still have one night together. JACOB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And we're not going to waste it. Jacob stands up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jacob paces back and forth in front of Scott and Karen. KAREN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Scott, we need you. SCOTT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, I don't know what's going on  anymore.  Two of my friends die and now  you tell me I have to drop into dreamland  with you guys to do battle with the dude  that did it. JACOB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'll have help. SCOTT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ah, yes.  I almost forgot.  The Sleepy  Squad.  Alright.  I'll make you a deal.   I told you I wouldn't believe this stuff  unless I saw it.  If I understand this  correctly, all I have to do is fall  asleep and you just whisk me into the  action. JACOB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right. SCOTT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay.  If that happens, if both of you  show up in my dream, I'll help you out.   If nothing happens, then I'll get a good  night's sleep and laugh at you in the  morning. JACOB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fine.  You got a deal.  And you won't be  disappointed. KAREN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm going to be sleeping in the girl's  dorm.  Will you be able to bring me in? JACOB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I hope so.  Then I got to make sure we  all end up in Springwood. SCOTT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The old stomping ground? JACOB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.  Only right now it's not a very  pretty place. KAREN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do we do when we get there? JACOB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Play it by ear.  And try and stay alive. A SOCIAL WORKER sticks his head into the lounge. SOCIAL WORKER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Half hour til lights out, everyone. The kids get up and start for the door. JACOB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Off we go. SCOTT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Into the wild black yonder. Scott shakes his head as they leave.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Karen lies in bed, under the covers.  She holds the pictu of herself, thirteen years old.  She stares at it.  Still that missing piece. Karen puts the picture on a nightstand and closes her eye

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Scott lies on the top of a set of bunk beds.  Jacob is on bottom and already looks asleep.

dialogues.speaker: ON SCOTT
dialogues.text: He's still awake.  Maybe he's starting to believe some of Jacob's ramblings, because he nervously fidgets in bed. SCOTT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Freddy Krueger.  Yeah, right.  Years ago  some sicko gets fried and now he comes  back to stick it to you when you're  snoozing.  Stupid bedtime story. he sighs, looks at his wrist, but his watch isn't on.  Th SCOTT (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, Mr. Creepoid, you still up? (a beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yo, Jacob? There's still no answer.  Scott rolls and peeks over the of the bunk bed.  And Jacob's not there. SCOTT (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Huh? Scott sits up, looks around.  And FALLS right through the middle of his bed, NOT appearing underneath the top bunk. just disappears.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Scott falls out of a tree and lands with a THUD.  He groa slowly gets to his feet and takes in his surroundings. The road is dark and desolate.  The street lights emit a brown glow and there are no stars or moon in the sky. SOUNDS echo through the trees and buildings.  Weird MOANS odd GURGLINGS, eerie WHISPERS, and an occasional unearthl HOWL. This does not comfort Scott. SCOTT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, this is lovely. He starts cautiously walking down the sidewalk.  SOMETHIN flies by with a FLAPPING.  Scott ducks.  Was it a bird or bat or what?  It's already gone. Then a craggy voice calls out from behind a tree. BUM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, buddy? SCOTT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, what? Scott is understandably jumpy.  The dark figure of a BUM  starts walking towards him.  Scott backs away. BUM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can you spare some change? SCOTT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Um, well, let me see... Scott starts sifting through his pockets, and the BUM ste out into the light. He has THREE EYES and a HUMP BACK.  Scott YELPS. SCOTT (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Holy Jesus Christ. The Bum grins and Scott starts stumbling away, his voice  trailing off: SCOTT (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll catch you next time, buddy. The mutant bum belches.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Karen rounds a corner.  She walks nervously down the midd of the street.  There are no cars, and she wants to keep far away as possible from the houses on either side.  There is a CREAKING sound from one of those houses.  Kare turns her head to look. A craggy OLD WOMAN is rocking back and forth on her front porch.  She's eating something, something stringy and sli She munches away with a vacant look in her eyes. The something in her hands MOVES slightly.  The old woman meal is still alive. Karen gags and walks faster.  And a PANTING sound is hear like two dogs.  Someone is walking their pet down the  sidewalk.   It's the MUTANT WOMAN from Jacob's opening nightmare:  straggly hair, oozing sores, limping.  The source of the  multiple paintings is her single dog, all two heads of it The mutant woman waves unpleasantly at Karen.  Karen whim and starts to RUN.

dialogues.speaker: WITH KAREN
dialogues.text: She stumbles quickly down the street.  We catch fleeting  glimpses of other horrors, twisted shapes, bent shadows. Karen rounds a corner, and SCREAMS when she bumps into  someone.  It's Scott, out of breath from his own sprintin KAREN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Scott!  You're here. SCOTT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.  Fun town.  Talk to any of the  neighbors, yet? They're a swell bunch of  folks.   KAREN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh-huh.  Real friendly, too. SCOTT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So this is a dream? KAREN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And I'm in it with you.  Convinced? SCOTT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe I'm just dreaming bout being here  with you.  Wouldn't be the first time. KAREN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nope.  I tired that one already.  Doesn't  work.  Come on, we have to find Jacob. Scott nods and they take off down the street.  A cat with three tails slithers by.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jacob is standing motionless in the middle of the road. stares down into the darkness, a wooden expression on his face. Karen and Scott are running up behind him. KAREN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jacob!  Thank God! SCOTT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So this is the place, huh? Jacob's eyes are steady.  He hasn't yet acknowledged the  other's presence.  He eyes are fixed on the gloominess in front of him.  A look of vengeance beginning to grow as o SHOT MOVES IN on him. JACOB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm home. Karen and Scott are next to him now.  They stand silently with Jacob for a few seconds.  Then: KAREN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What now? JACOB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Scott, are you with us? SCOTT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A deal's a deal. JACOB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then we wait. And not for long.  FLASH!  In three bursts the Dream Poli appear directly across from the teenagers.  Scott and Kar jump back.  Jacob hold his ground. SCOTT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whoa! The threesomes stand face-to-face in two parallel rows. SCOTT (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nice outfits. POWER COP

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is this all? JACOB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All that's left. SOUND COP

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It'll have to do. SCOTT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We can always come back later.  Like when  it's daytime. POWER COP

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's always night here. JACOB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's the plan? BLADE COP

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We need you to draw him out. SCOTT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Terrific.  We're supposed to be bait. SOUND COP

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Essentially. JACOB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then let's do it. KABOOOOOOOOM!  A huge BRICK WALL, ten feet high and sprea out across the street and through the houses, BLASTS up f the asphalt.  Right between the Police and the kids.

dialogues.speaker: ON THE DREAM POLICE SIDE
dialogues.text: The three cops crouch into battle positions.

dialogues.speaker: ON THE TEENAGER'S SIDE
dialogues.text: The three of them have hardly any time to react before th perfectly round HOLES open up underneath each of them. And Scott, Jacob and Karen fall into darkness.

dialogues.speaker: ON THE DREAM POLICE SIDE
dialogues.text: Sound Cop stands up and his body begins to VIBRATE.  A ne noise emits from his mouth: a HIGH PITCHED SQUEAL. And like the walls of Jericho, the bricks in front of the fall apart and tumble to the ground.  Dust settles and th Police walk over the rubble to the other side.  The kids gone. BLADE COP

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fan out. The Dream Police break formation and scatter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A hole opens up in the road and WHOOSH, KAREN is elevated into the scene and the hole seals up instantly. She jumps  a few feet and drops to her knees, holding ont the ground.  She looks up at a street sign.  It reads: EL ST.  Karen stands up and heads down the road. EXT. ROCHESTER AVE. Another hole, and VOOM, Jacob is shot up into the street. spins around, trying to get his bearings.  It doesn't tak him long.  He knows exactly where he is. JACOB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh no... He starts to run and we FOLLOW him. Jacob jumps over a procession of RATS making their way ac the street and just keeps on sprinting.  Until he reaches certain house.  He catches his breath as he looks at the  building, pain registering on his face. JACOB (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mom... Jacob runs towards the house as our shot MOVES IN CLOSE t the mailbox and ate name printed across it.  It reads  JOHNSON.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jacob bursts through the door.  He turns on a light switc A lamp SPUTTERS into semi-life, and keeps sputtering, cas a candle-like glow over the interior.   Cobwebs and dust cover everything.  Rats and tarantula  spiders skitter about.  Jacob grits his teeth and walks i deeper.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Scott BLASTS out of the asphalt.  He staggers for a few  seconds from the ride, then looks at the building in fron him.  A puttering neon sign, SPRINGWOOD TAVERN', marks local saloon.  Muffled MUSIC and VOICES seep through the  cracks of the double doors.  Scott looks around, then shrugs.  He heads for the entran

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dump is too clean a word, dive is too nice, abomination i more like it.  A greenish haze covers everything.  Instea sawdust on the floor there is a collection of debris that looks like a compilation of human teeth, crushed bugs, an pools of unmentionable goo. Then there's the people. Imagine any profanity, any obscenity,any blasphemy, add t all up - then double them.  It wouldn't even come close t the patrons of this joint. They dance, they yell, they drink bloody bubbling mixture There's a guy to the right that doesn't seem to mind that half his brain is showing.  That girl over there has no j In a booth is a couple that are connected at the lips.  A ventriloquist on stage is entertaining the troops with hi hand up the back of a real body. Scott steps through the door and blinks about a dozen tim Then he decides that the smart course of action is to tur around and go right back out. A MUTANT BOUNCER, half his face a skull, blocks Scott's w MUTANT BOUNCER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two drink minimum. SCOTT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ah, that's okay.  I think I'm underage,  anyway. MUTANT BOUNCER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two drink minimum. SCOTT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, really.  I'm driving. MUTANT BOUNCER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two drink minimum. The bouncer with the limited vocabulary seems adamant.  S backs off and turns around.  He carefully moves forward. MUTANT WAITRESS with three breasts slips next to him. MUTANT WAITRESS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can I get you anything? SCOTT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's okay.  I'll just sit at the bar. MUTANT WAITRESS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alright, honey.  You call if you need  anything. SCOTT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You bet.  You'll be the first to know. Scott turns away, trying to keep his eyes in their socket He slides up to the bar next to a MUTANT BUSINESSMAN.  Th man's head is on backwards, his arms lean on the bar whil his face looks out into the crowd.  He has to twist his n to sip his vile drink. A BARTENDER, surprisingly normal-looking, steps up to Sco BARTENDER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What'll it be? SCOTT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Um, a beer, I guess. The bartender fills a twisted glass with a sickly brown  liquid.  Chunks of matter float amongst the foam.  Scott  takes the drink warily and looks up at the businessman ne to him.  The mutant smiles at him. BARTENDER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go on.  Puts hair on your back. SCOTT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And that's all? The bartender returns.  Holds one of those half pineapple type drinks in his hand, except this one has the back end a wriggling lizard sticking out of mucousy fluid under a umbrella.  He gives it to Scott. SCOTT (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's okay, this'll be plenty. BARTENDER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No charge.  Compliments of the man at the  end of the bar. The bartender walks away and Scott cranes his head to loo down the bar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The crowd blocks his view, but we can see a gloved hand w four blades strapped to it tapping nonchalantly on the  surface of the wood.

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO SCOTT
dialogues.text: He picks up his drinks, holding the moving one at arm's  length, and heads down the bar.

dialogues.speaker: AT THE END OF THE BAR
dialogues.text: sits Freddy Krueger.  He sips coolly on some hideous  concoction as Scott sits down in the chair next to him an lights a cigarette, trying to look equally cool. FREDDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Welcome to my favorite haunt. SCOTT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So you're the man. FREDDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At your service. SCOTT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's on your mind? FREDDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A deal. SCOTT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A deal's what got me into this. FREDDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bring Jacob to me. Scott, valiantly holding on to his nerve, raises an eyebr SCOTT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's in it for me? FREDDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Power.  You don't need to hang out with  those losers. You're a take-charge kind  of guy, Scott.  Like when you took charge  of your father. Suddenly Freddy is spinning a gun on the bar with his fre hand.  Scott grimaces. SCOTT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leave my father out of this. FREDDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll make you mayor of Rosedale. SCOTT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: After you make it look like this? FREDDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can have Karen. That was Freddy's trump card.  It really hits a nerve in  Scott.  Karen's everything he's ever wanted. SCOTT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alive? FREDDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Any way you want her. SCOTT (after a beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay. FREDDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shake? Krueger holds out his knives.  Scott shakes his head. SCOTT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No thanks.  I trust you. Freddy laughs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jacob opens the door into darkness. JACOB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mother? He turns on the light and a RED HAZE blankets the room.   Jacob looks up.  The dish-like ceiling lamp is filled wit blood. Jacob walks into the room, tears welling.  He walks by  Alice's vanity, her makeup still sitting there as if she  might show up and use it at any moment. He steps up to a wardrobe closet and touches the edges of lightly.  He reaches out and slowly, almost reverently, o the doors.  Dozens of writhing SNAKES drop out of the closet and slit onto the ground. Jacob jumps back and SCREAMS. Then he just stands there in the middle of the teaming  reptile mass, not giving a shit anymore, going insane.  H fists clenched, his head tilted back, as he YELLS into th air like a wolf baying at the moon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Scott steps off the sidewalk and looks up and down the  street.  He thinks and we MOVE IN on him. SCOTT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mayor of Rosedale. Scott sneers. SCOTT (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What a crock of shit. We PULL WIDER as Scott cups his hands around his mouth. SCOTT (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey!  He's over here.  Yo!  Dream Police.   Hello!  Come on.  Move you collective  asses.

dialogues.speaker: SCOTT
dialogues.text: He puts his hands on his hips and sighs. SCOTT (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Never a cop around when you need one. GLITCH! a stabbing sound of flesh, and Scott JERKS violen as our shot PULLS BACK to reveal: Freddy behind Scott, his deadly fingers buried in the boy back.  Scott chokes on his own blood as Krueger growls. FREDDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I hate a snitch! Freddy pulls out his blades as Scott falls forward and wi his final breath utters: SCOTT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eat shit... His body hits the ground with a THUD as a sudden ROAR fil the air.  Freddy looks around for its source.  And Sound drops down on him with a SMACK. The two of them tumble, then both jump up. Freddy laughs. Sound Cop looks down at Scott's body, then back up at  Krueger.  His body is shaking with fury,and he opens his  mouth. The loudest sound yet comes from Sound Cop.  KABOOM!  A b of air at Mach 3 smacks into Freddy and sends him sailing back, SMASHING right through the Tavern wall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Freddy flies sideways, right through the bar, destroying  chandeliers as he careens through and punches yet another huge hole through the opposite wall. The nightmarish customers don't even seem to notice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jacob is shuffling down the stairs as a SONIC BOOM of noi echoes through the streets outside. He knows exactly what that sound means as we MOVE IN on h face. JACOB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Krueger... Jacob races for the front door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The dust is just starting to settle as a THUD is heard co from the hole in the opposite wall.  Quickly followed by  Freddy's soaring body.  Krueger SMASHES into some tables slides across the floor.  Power Cop steps through the hol his fists clenched.  Freddy stands up and dusts himself o FREDDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lighten up, bone brain. Power Cop has no intention to.  He bolts over, grabs Krue raises him over his head like a wrestler, slams him down the bar, and SHOVES Freddy, knocking glasses and ashtrays aside until he SMACKS into yet another poor wall. Krueger barely gets back on his feet when Power Cop is ri on him again.  The big man in black SWINGS, but this time Freddy DUCKS.  CRACK! a support column bursts into dust. Freddy twirls around.  And the two of them start to PUNCH each other. It's a barroom brawl between non-humans as Power Cop and  Freddy Krueger exchange multiple blows. SMACK SMACK SMACK!  Freddy nails Power Cop, whose head ba seems to budge from the hits. POW POW POW!  Power Cop lays into Krueger, sending him  spinning and tumbling only to pick him up and start the  process all over again. This goes on for a while, and Krueger is losing. The mutant bouncer finally steps up to Power Cop to try a put a stop to all this. MUTANT BOUNCER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Take it outside! CRUNCH!  Power Cop puts a stop to the bouncer with a vici elbow in the chest.  All this gave Freddy a few seconds t grab a chair and crack it ineffectually over the Cop's he The pummeling begins again. THWACK THWACK THWACK!  Power Cop is punching Freddy towar the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Like in an old wester, Krueger flies out of the double do and somersaults onto the pavement.  Sound Cop is a few ya away knelt down next to Scott's dead body.  He looks up a Freddy sneers. FREDDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No more playing around. Freddy raises his left fist and it begins to EXPAND.  It  grows like an inflated beach ball, except it doesn't look soft at all.  Freddy slides up to the side of the entranc and raises his giant hammer hand.  Power Cop steps throug looking for blood.  Sound Cop tries to warn him. SOUND COP

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kincaid! Too late.  BAM!  Freddy's fist slams down on Power Cop's  head.  He's actually shoved down into the ground a full t feet - trapped at the legs. BAM!  Freddy hits him again.  Power Cop is down to his th and he can't get out. A RUMBLING is heard.  Freddy turns to see Sound Cop start to open his mouth.  Krueger instantly reaches down and gr a brick from the rubble and THROWS it at Sound Cop. FREDDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Put a lid on it! THUNK!  The brick lands squarely in Sound Cop's mouth,  stretching it painfully and blocking it completely.  Soun Cop reels from the impact.  Tries to pull out the firmly  wedged plug. Freddy turns back to Power Cop, BAM!  Hits him down to hi hips.  The giant fist swings, BAM BAM BAM BAM BAM! like  hammering a nail until Power Cop DISAPPEARS into the grou Freddy's hand deflates to regular size as he turns to the struggling Sound Cop. Sound Cop's head is EXPANDING.  Pressure seems to be buil up, something's gonna blow.  Freddy picks up a boulder fr the street rubble.  He catapults it with both hands at So Cop.  The boulder hits Sound Cop's head and takes it CLEA OFF. Sound Cop's decapitated skull tumbles away with the brick still stuck, as a blast of air shoots up from the stump o his neck with a SCREECH. Sound Cop's body stumbles for a few seconds, then falls o limply. Freddy LAUGHS and laughs and laughs... KACHUNK! until a K embeds itself in his back.  Krueger spins around. CHUNK CHUNK CHUNK!  Three more knives slam into his body he staggers back in surprise.  Blade Cop stands twenty fe away reaching into thin air and whipping out knife after  knife, flinging them at Freddy.  They sail like flying  bullets. CHUNK CHUNK CHUNK!  Krueger falls back from the sheer for of the onslaught, at least a dozen blades sticking out of body.   Blade stops. She stands there for a beat, waiting to see Freddy will do next. Krueger sways, looking like an inhuman pincushion.  Then grins.  His body steadies, and he suddenly poses like a b builder and flexes every muscle. POP POP POP!  The daggers shoot out of his torso and limb CLATTERING to the ground. The girl in black steps back and raises her arms.  SHINK  SHINK!  Two-foot-long sabers jut out from her forearms.   They're not held by her, they're a PART of her, exiting f the tops of her wrists under her clenched fists.  She cro the blades in front of her. FREDDY (cont'd) (smiling)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ah... a girl after my own heart. KACHINK! Freddy shoots out his finger knives and they EXT to double their normal size.  He raises them and takes on fencing stance. FREDDY (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: En guard, bitch SWOOP/CLANG!  A swordfight ensues.  Freddy swinging his f long knives.  Blade slashing her rapier-arms.  They lunge they parry, they leap, they duck. CLANG!  They connect.  SCREEEEE.  Metal scrapes metal.  I a bastardized version of an Errol Flynn movie and Blade C and Freddy are equally matched.  Blade moves to get the u hand. CLINK CLINK!  Blades shoot out of the girl's ELBOWS.  Now when she takes a swing with her fists, another sword is r behind it on the follow-through. Freddy gets caught off-guard.  Gets slashed twice in the  shoulder and twirls away.  Then starts to move FASTER. Blade counters with an equally increased intensity.  Fred ducks, SWOOPS out twice quickly.  A fold of black cloth d down on Blade's stomach, revealing naked skin and a littl blood.  They pause for a second. FREDDY (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Touche. And Blade becomes AIRBORNE putting a Samurai to shame,  twirling her legs up and out as a blade juts momentarily her RIGHT HEEL, chopping off Freddy's left hand. Krueger stumbles back in astonishment as green goo spurts of the stump. Astonishment turns to rage as the two converge again,  swinging away at an incredible rate.  An impossible rate. JACOB rounds the corner.  He stumbles into the action jus the battling pair are becoming an obscure swirling GLINTI MASS.  Pieces of them start to drop away. Blade's foot hits the ground.  Freddy's arm plops away. broken sword hits the asphalt under the spinning cloud, t one of Blade's arms.

dialogues.speaker: JACOB
dialogues.text: as he watches, his eyes dart to try to follow the action  that's moving too fast for him to see. Then there's silence. We PULL BACK and PAN  to follow Jacob as he walks into th scene of carnage.  He steps up to two pills of remains: o black and flesh colored covered with red blood, the other heap of red and green cloth, scarred tissues, and pukish  green glop. Blade and Freddy have literally chopped each other to bit the two mounds of body parts steaming in the cold night a Jacob sees something else and walks over to it.  It's Sco body.  Jacob kneels down next to the dead teenager. JACOB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry, Scott. A CRACKING sound makes Jacob stand up.  Over to the now- silent bar entrance a BLACK FIST punches up through the  cement.  With a crumbling of granite, Power Cop rises fro the earth. Something else moves behind Jacob and he turns, then SCRE Sound Cop's headless body walks into the shot, his arms h ABOVE FRAME over his neck. Then Sound Cop's arms lower his dismembered HEAD onto his stump, push it down, twist it til it stays.  With great  effort, Sound Cop yanks the brick out of his mouth.   Jacob now looks OFF SCREEN at something else, something t REALLY makes his eyes widen.  We get to see the shadow of what Jacob sees, projected on the wall of the bar behind The shadow of the pile of body parts that was Blade Cop  begins to MOVE.  The pieces start to REFORM, leg to torso arm to shoulder, head to neck.  The shadow on the wall ri and we PULL BACK. Blade Cop stands across from Jacob, whole again except fo flash of exposed flesh on her abdomen to remind her of th experience. Jacob raises his eyebrows as the resurrected Dream Police step around him. JACOB (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, I'm impressed Blade whips her visor up to reveal an upset girl's face. BLADE COP

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You shouldn't be. Jacob frowns as the four of them walk over to the pile of Freddy remains.  But they're not remains anymore.  All th left of Freddy is a stack of CLOTH remnants. A WIND rises and pieces of cloth blow away into the darkn The other two Dream Police raise their visors, looking  equally distraught.  They all face Jacob. BLADE COP (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is what we were afraid of. SOUND COP

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He still exists. JACOB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What!  How? POWER COP

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're already dead, that's why he  couldn't destroy us. BLADE COP

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But he's not dead. He's not alive either.   He's something in between. SOUND COP

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's not entirely part of reality or part  of dreams.  He's unique. BLADE COP

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WE can't kill him. POWER COP

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We can wail away on each other until  doomsday and not do any good. JACOB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then who's going to kill this fucker? SOUND COP

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: YOU have to. JACOB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How the hell am I supposed to do that? BLADE COP

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Krueger's power comes from his rage and  the souls of children. POWER COP

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You have to find the original source of  that rage and use it against him. BLADE COP

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This town in its present condition  encompasses all evils from all times in  its history.  The answer is here  somewhere... Jacob sighs, then gets an idea. JACOB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think I know where... And he starts to run down the street. BLADE COP

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jacob, wait.  We have to find him first. JACOB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No time.  You guys find Karen! He disappears down the road as the Dream Police snap down their visors

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Karen stands in front of a rotted gate in front of a run building with shuttered windows and a crumbling foundatio This isn't just an ELM STREET house, it's THE Elm Street  house.  And for some reason Karen is drawn to it.  She lo to her let at the bent mailbox. It has a name plate on it.  Another one underneath it.  A another.  It's as if people moved in and out and instead changing the plates on the mailbox, they just whacked a n one over the old.  Karen steps closer to the mailbox. The little sign on the top reads WILLIAMS.  She touches i with her finger and it drops off, the nails holding it on rusted away to dust.  A new plate is revealed.  This one THOMPSON. Karen picks lightly at it, and it swings away. name underneath makes Karen gasp. It reads KRUEGER. And there's still another one under that horrible name.   Karen quickly hits the Krueger plate off.  The last sign  reads UNDERWOOD. Karen frowns.  She turns back to the house, a determined  expression on her face. KAREN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No more... She KICKS the gate open and walks up to the house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We've been here before, haven't we?  But for Karen it's t first visit as she opens the front door and walks in.  Sh takes in the twisted skeleton of a home for a few seconds then begins to SEARCH it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Karen races through, pulling open desk drawers, rifling  through shelves, flipping through books.  She doesn't kno what she's looking for, but she knows she hasn't found it yet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The intensity of Karen's quest increases as she yanks ope cabinets and tosses plates to the floor.  Still nothing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Karen runs up them, a girl with a mission.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Karen flings the door open.  Nothing but a bed and a set drawers.  No hint as to the occupant's lives.  She doesn' bother ransacking this one and goes on to:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jackpot.  Karen stares through the open door at a child's room, a very twisted child's room.  She slowly walks in. A bed, a desk, a dresser.  There's a Jack-in-a-box with i head torn off.  A disemboweled Teddy Bear.  White puffy g hanging out of it.  A clown doll with its face caved in. hanging mobile made of strange bent shapes. And a pile of more-than-dirty clothes. Karen goes over to the pile and picks through it with her toe.  A small pair of pants, about the right size for an  eight-year-old.  A black pair of shoes.  And a little  sweater, a RED AND GREEN STRIPED sweater. Karen goes over to the desk.  There is stack of drawings it - a child's drawings.  On one of them it looks like  someone was practicing writing their name.  FREDDY UNNERW FREDDY UNDERWUD, FREDDY UNDERWOOD over and over again.  U the final attempt has the last name angrily crossed out,  replaced underneath by a hastily scrawled KRUEGER!!! Another piece of paper: a set of human stick figures.  A  small one is labeled FREDDY.  The large one is labeled DA The Daddy figure is depicted HITTING the Freddy figure. There are more drawings, all of them violent, the large  figure beating away at the small one. Suddenly a CREAKING.  Karen jumps.  Hides behind a booksh She's nervously trying to figure out what to do when a fr picture catches her attention on the shelf.  It's a pictu of a tall, dark man and a little boy.  Karen reaches out grab the picture, but accidentally knocks over a glass mu with a CRASH. FOOTSTEPS can now be heard tromping up the stairs.   Someone's coming and Karen's on the edge of panic.  She l around and finds an old baseball bat.  She grabs it and r to the side of the doorway as the FOOTSTEPS approach down hallway.  Karen raises the bat. And Jacob appears.  Karen pulls back with the bat as Jaco jumps away from her. KAREN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jacob!  You scared the shit out of me! JACOB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The feeling is mutual. KAREN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where are the Dream Police? JACOB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I told them to look for you.  What are  you doing here?  Don't you know what this  place is? KAREN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I do now.  Look what I found. She starts to drag him over to the desk of drawings. JACOB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You've got to get out of here. KAREN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait.  You have to see this. JACOB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't understand.  The Police can't  kill Freddy.  They literally chopped each  other to pieces and he's still alive!   Now I'm supposed to figure out how to get  rid of him. KAREN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But I think I found the answer.  Shut up  for a second and look at these. She starts showing him the scrawlings. JACOB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, so he's a bad artist. KAREN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No!  You told me Krueger's mother  committed suicide and no one knows who  his father was, right? JACOB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah... KAREN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Freddy's been pushing all our buttons  with our pasts.  These are HIS past.   Don't you get it? HE was a foster child,  too! She walks over to the bookshelf and grabs the picture of  LITTLE FREDDY and FREDDY'S FOSTER FATHER. KAREN (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Someone had to have taken care of him.   This guy...he was Freddy's father.  Those  drawings...they were Freddy's childhood.   This house...it's where it all happened. JACOB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But in reality Freddy hasn't lived here  for decades. KAREN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Like you tried to tell me once before,  this is a dream.  Who knows why this is  all here. JACOB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All evils from all times in history... KAREN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And isn't this where it all started in  Springwood?  On Elm Street? Jacob thinks for a second.  It's all starting to make sen JACOB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But what does this do for us? KAREN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's got to be a way to use it against  him. JACOB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, but we're not going to stand around  here to figure out how. It's too  dangerous. He grabs her hand and pulls her towards her door. JACOB (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's get out of this house. They head out to

dialogues.speaker: UPSTAIRS HALLWAY
dialogues.text: And Blade Cop is standing in the middle of the corridor. two teenagers stop. JACOB (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank God.  Freddy's going to show up any  minute. KACHINK!  A knife shoots out of Blade's right hand, ready action.  (but wait a minute, her uniform isn't ripped  anymore...)  Karen and Jacob make their way to the stairs He turns to Blade. JACOB (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where are the others? Blade walks up to him and stands there.  Then JAMS HER KN into JACOB'S GUT.  Karen SCREAMS.  Jacob chokes.  Blade C shoves the knife in further until it juts out of Jacob's  back.  She turns. Then BECOMES FREDDY. FREDDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Time to join your mommy. Krueger yanks his finger blades out and Jacob's limp body falls at Karen's feet.  Karen shrieks and cries, dropping her knees to hold him. KAREN
